Hard to judge only by the numbers alone but rather "OF" the whole concept !  Very quiet so use the cruise control isolation makes it hard to feel just how fast your going. No buyers remorse here. Not a drivers car but rather "luxury"  transportation.  Arrive alive and in great shape! So for value comfort resale and reliability this "IS" a compact SUV to consider.

Vehicle_Title: 2016 Lexus NX 200t SUV 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
Review_Title: New 2016 NXt AWD first drive and impressions
Review: Great car! Picked it up new a week ago and have had the pleasure of driving around town and a snow trip up to Flagstaff for a ski trip. It handles great around town and performed just as well on the 400 mile round trip to break in the AWD on snow. The car handles like a dream and very similar to the older 2008 328i I previously owned. I was pleasantly surprised how well the SUV handled the elevation change from 1000 feet up to 9500 feet. The turbo is flawless and at all times felt adequately powered. Several times I was surprised I was traveling too fast and had to use the cruise control to not break the law. The AWD performed well on the nasty road up to the ski slopes. I was deciding between this SUV and Subaru offerings. I feel I made the right decision and could not tolerate a 10 week wait for a 3.6 liter alternative. This SUV is extremely comfortable and a joy to drive. All riders tell me how sweet this Lexus drives. This is my 4th Lexus and the best so far.7/11/2016 Update - Still love the car after 6k miles. I've dropped the visibility to poor. It is hard to see the blind spot.7/11/2017 Update - Car is great. The visibility is still bad. BSM needs to be standard equipment.7/11/2018 update - car is still very nice. BSM NEEDS TO BE STANDARD. For this reason i will be returning in five months when the lease is done.
The 2015 Lexus RC350 is a beautiful sports coupe that is reliable and very quick. The only negative comment that I have is the difficult entry access to anyone that is 5'-10" and taller.

I was looking for something different- and this is it.  Smooth and just enough power to make it fun.   Found it!!!!    I smile every time I get in the car - and with Lexus reliability- I will be doing that for a while.   Not a track car - but that is not what I wanted.  This is a great trip car for two!    Great deals to be had on 2015!

Exciting styling, impressive craftsmanship, quality, and peace of mind reliability. I opted for this car, after researching some BMW, and Mercedes offerings, all in all this lexus fits a good balance of what's most important in the long run, comfort and reliability. Sure the German cars offer up more powerful engines, but at what cost? Theirs also the factor of the RC bold styling,  no one will mistake you for the everyday beamer you see going down the road.                                                                                                        The only cons I can nit pick at are the less then stellar MPG, the dated infotament system, and perhaps the engines modest 306hp. By all means the power is plenty for everyday driving, passing power, and adequate enough for some fun in the streets. I think any lexus owner can agree the infotainment system needs a overhaul ASAP, it's not horrible, but it's just so bland in appearance and function. Gas mileage can be decent if you baby it, however you can quickly find yourself in the 17-19mpg in the city trying to escape traffic.                                                Over all I would by this car again, and hope to see lexus fix some of the minor issues in the future. (Turbo 6, updated infotainment, weight reduction)
This is a very comfortable, pleasure to drive car.  I owned a 1999 350SC and hated to part with it. Drove it 13 years.  Tried an Infinity and switched back to Lexus in 2015. Happy again!

Have really enjoyed this car.  Great value for the money, with Lexus quality and reliability.  Was a bit disappointing after driving an SC for 10 years, which had more luxury interior, and lots more storage. New technology is fantastic!  Love the Mark Levinson, sounds fantastic.

This is my 5th Lexus. All have been exceptional, but this coupe is a blast to drive. Test drove 435,A5 and C300, all were very fine cars. But to me the Lexus once again was the total package. Not quite as fast as the BMW or the Audi but fast enough for most people and the ride and handling are superb, and the looks from people stopping in their tracks to stare, mine is in Infared and Playa.

Review_Title: not a car for old farts!
Review: I love the car , but getting g in and out is a pain , that is the only reason i am looking to change to an SUV

I was searching for a great looking sports car, with great reliability and yet that still had a back seat for my 2 small kids, and AWD for snow. After months of searching this was it. The BMW 4 series was a close second but comments about reliability, bland styling and the shear numbers of BMWs out there, I picked this car. The only negative thing I have to say about it is that it is not as fast as it looks! It is much slower than I expected but the ride and handling are superb.Update:Still a great car and still turning heads as it rolls by. Gas mileage is not great about 16 in town and 23-25 on the highway. The only negative thing is that the paint is very, very thin and seems to scratch and stain very easily. Regular washing and waxing have helped but that was not something I anticipated.

Excellent machine.  Intuitive.  Understated elegance.  Quality of materials are top notch.  Quite cabin.  Fit / Finish / Paint meticulous.  LexusGot right in first year coupe what Infiniti couldn't get right on the G37 and A5 since production.  Wonderful car.  Delivered in perfection.  Gas mileage is also good.  Very nice ride and one of the best looking coupes out there!

Review_Title: The right stuff! (as in pulls hard right)
Review: The steering is horrible. The vehicle alignment throws you to the curb, especially on wet surfaces. According to two different dealerships, the car is within spec. This is a car that is all for show, definitely not performance (and I opted for the F Sport). If you are an enthusiast, stick with the Germans or Brits. The pursuit of perfection? Far from it.Update: Since the above mentioned issue, Lexus of Tampa Bay went above and beyond to handle correcting the issue. ALL 8 South Florida locations I visited either inspected the car and retutned it with condescending and/or bogus explanations or outright refused to look at the car. The worst offender being JM Lexus. Lexus of Tampa were the only one interested in pleasing a customer. In summation, once corrected, the car has indeed been pleasing to drive but, it is more or less just for turning heads and getting attention. If you are a Toyota brand enthusiast, get a V6 Camary or a Lexus IS and save 10's of thousands. The early experience, poor customer service from Corporate and time that I had to invest in order to correct a factory issue they tried to ignore has made me a one time only Toyota/Lexus brand buyer.

The Lexus 350 RC is the best car I have ever owned.  The performance, style & drive is amazing.  I have people stop me daily at red lights or in parking lots complimenting my gorgeous Lexus. Thanks Thompson Lexus for the honest salesman & th excellent service area!!!  I won't buy anywhere else!!!

Review_Title: Great mix of  sportiness, comfort, tech and MPG.
Review: It is by far the best looking coupe on the road for the money, can't think of one that is even remotely close to it.  The looks and color (atomic silver) have been complimented many times in the 30 days that I have owned mine.  The ride quality is what you expect out of a Lexus and the gas mileage is on par with the weight and size of the engine.  The note of the engine/exhaust is fun when you put your foot in it.  Many people have commented that they want more power, it would be nice, but then they would definitely cry about the fuel economy.  If you want more power, spend another $20k and get the RCF.  As you would expect in a couple, the size is small and the windows are narrow, but with the blind spot, cross traffic and rearview cameras it is fine.  I am 6'6" and have about 1-2" of head room left.

This car looks like a hot rod and rides like a luxury sedan. It really is the best of both worlds, although it can be a challenge to get in an out for some. The front seats are very comfortable, rear seats are pretty much reserved for kids or small packages. Like others have said, the navigation controls are a bit confusing and I still can't figure out how to change the XM radio stations from the steering wheel mounted controls. The climate controls themselves are a bit hard to reach - especially the dashboard mounted radio tuning knob if you like to sit farther back from the steering wheel. The car is pretty quiet and is a great cruiser - acceleration is adequate under normal conditions but the car does get up and go when you step on it- and it sounds great. I chose the Lexus RC 350 AWD over the BMW 428XI because there are too many BMW's on the road  - not that they will be there for long considering their reliability issues. Overall - I'd recommend the RC 350 to anyone looking for a reliable yet unique luxury sports coupe under 60 grand.

Review_Title: Love Love Love my RC 350 F Sport
Review: I spent months reading reviews, watching video road tests, and test driving myself, but 2 weeks ago I finally purchased a RC 350 F Sport.  The car is the ultimate mix of luxury and sport.  The ability to change the driving dynamics from Eco, Normal, Sport to Sport+ make it feel like you own two cars at once.  If cruising in quite and luxury is your thing Eco or Normal and if you want aggressive shift points and tighter suspension then Sport+ makes the car rock!  The interior is such a contemporary mix of materials and touches that it's a treat every time I get into the car.  The Lexus Touchpad interface for Navigation system does take some getting used to.  It's jumpy at first, but after a few days you will have it mastered.  Steering wheel and dash controls make most systems in the car redundant so there are many ways to do things.1yr later-Still enjoying driving the RC each and everyday. Had a few unexpected squeaks/rattles that needed to be addressed with the dealer. All were fixed but a. It disappointed they happened at all coming from Lexus. Also a bit disappointed in the quality of the paint on the hood. I drive less then 1,000 per month, yet have more hood paint sings then you would expect. Still the sporty and luxury coup I expected. The only thing I don't love is that when you enter and exit the car you have to climb in and climb out.  I had a mustang prior and it was easier to enter/exit then the Lexus.  It might just sit lower to the ground and take some getting used to.

Overall this car does inherit Lexus comfort and reliability. Smooth ride and stunning exterior. Inside is a bit tight as expected in a sport car frame, but very quiet and ride is relatively smooth. Acceleration is not one of the strongest feature of this car and in Sport mode there is a bit of hesitation at the start from a complete stop. I have the Luxury package on this car and for most part it is loaded with features, but some important features are lacking compared to my older Lexus that had only the Premium package (See suggested improvements).

First of all. I will agree 100% with Lee Monk's review above. This vehicle is definitely a very attractive car. We have got so much attention, all thumbs up. It also replaces our 2013 GS which I very much liked. It's fun to drive, fit and finish is excellent. Ride is great for a sports car. Dependability is part of the brand name. The navigation is a little pain to operate. The screen could full up the area, that would be welcomed.

This was a replacement for our 2013 Lexus  GS 350. Weve had the car for about three months at this point and there are some pluses and minuses to highlight. First off to the "so called experts" who knock the looks of this car, this car is visually stunning. I've had at least 100 people stop me to ask what kind of Lexus is it, and they comment on how gorgeous it is. I have the Ultrasonic Blue with playa interior. The interior fit and finish are exceptional. The F Sport seats have the right amount of side bolstering for fast cornering. Here are my gripes with this car. The engine is underwhelming. This is the same engine from the GS but it seems to be tuned much less sporty.Update***  It's been 2+ years since I purchased the RC350. I  have found lots to like about the vehicle (e.g. styling, reliability, functionality)  while the same issues that plagued the car after a few months still exist ( bad fuel economy, glitch CPU  for navigation). Lexus somewhat addressed the fuel economy by introducing the 4 cylinder turbo RC. I would purchase this vehicle over again knowing what I do now about it. For my needs it checks off many of the boxes and their aren't droves of them on the streets (ala BMW 4 series).Update*** It has been almost three years since I leased the RC350. Styling wise it has aged well, but technology wise three years is a lifetime. The interior has held up well and the overall mechanics of the car work fine. Lexus has seemingly abandoned this car from an advertising standpoint as everything is now compact SUV biased. If you are in the market for an RC search around because great deals are out there.

The Lexus RC350 is a fun car for long drives and touring rather than racing. Everything about this car is about lifestyle and opportunity for older clients to really enjoy a Lexus as well as comfort and performance. Since I will not be putting on many miles over the next 3 years of the lease, this car with low miles would be perfect to keep and enjoy for the long haul.

We were trying to find the RC in white w/red interior and not much luck. Then happened upon the RC350 SPORT BLACK EDITION ‼️Long story short this car has to be seen to fully appreciate what Lexus did with this car. WHAT A MACHINE

Review_Title: Best car I’ve owned so far!
Review: This car is amazing! Sure, it’s not the most powerful in it’s class but it has much more power than you need on the roads in the country taking the speed limits into consideration.The car is insanely comfortable and looks very classy and sporty in my opinion and is beautifully crafted. The infotainment screen could be larger, but I believe they took care of that in the 2018 model. The handling on it is amazing, you get good control of the car even at high speeds. The grip of the steering wheel feels great and the seats are sporty and comfortable at the same time. The gauge cluster is heavenly too! (On the Fsport model only).Not to mention all the options and safety features that are available on the car.I don’t mean to put anybody down with this but comparing it to it’s main competitor the Infinity Q60 (in my opinion) I would take the RC any day! The Q60 is cheaply built compared to the RC. Just look at the blind spot monitors that come with the Q60! They look like cheap aftermarket products! And they are located at the cars pillars not in the mirrors! But again, that’s just my opinion.I would definitely recommend the Lexus RC 350 (Fsport if possible) to anybody in the market for a car in it’s class. At the end of the day, it’s a Lexus. Which means that it adds great reliability to sport and comfort! It’s the perfect package!
The price data is only for reference.  Options will push up the bargain price.

Review_Title: Easily turned into a road warrior
Review: I love the sophistication of the standard RC350 F-Sport but it lacked performance to match it's looks. No one wants their 60k sport coupe to get blown away by a souped up Golf R-type great car that it is, so I turned to the aftermarket and with a growing owner base performance options are out there now and for less than 3 grand I have an RC350 F-Sport faster than its big brother the RF-f. It's still quite and smooth riding when I want it be but a real beast when I let it loose. I love driving this car just for the sake of driving it...even more than my classic 911. Strong recommendation

Review_Title: Lexus RC350 F Sport is Outstanding
Review: This is a smooth running comfortable car with lots of power. The paddle shifters give you an extra "kick-down" gear when you want to zip around someone or merge onto the freeway. The F Sport has plenty of power for street driving, but don't be confused by the two designations Lexus uses for the RC. There's the F Sport and the even more upscale version just called the RC F. The F Sport is the tamer 3.5 liter 306 hp one. The F is the even more upscale screamer V8 that has 400+ horses and the price to match....about $30k more. Almost two years after I acquired the car it have proven to be the most reliable brand I’ve ever purchased. This is my fourth Lexus since 1998 and none can be be beat for reliability. The RC-350 continues to be outstanding value. I would buy it again.

Review_Title: My new RC 350 is still going strong 18 months in
Review: Nothing new to report.  Car is still great and plan on keeping a long time.
Very reliable, fun to drive and such an easy keeper compared to other luxury convertibles.

This car is a complete joy.  Two of my best friends also drive the Lexus SC430, and we all agree. It's the most fun, feel-good car we've ever driven!  I enjoy the ease of the retractable hardtop and love the design/look of this car.  People stop to compliment this beautiful Lexus.

This is a great reliable car. Workmanship is excellent. Our last car was a 2005 Corvette and it spent many days at the repair shop. This car has never had any repair problems and it has 36,000 miles on it. I would strongly recommend this car.

I have owned  as many as 50 cars in my time. My lexus sc 430 convertible out wins them all. The leather is so soft and inviting that I can ride in the car all day. The sound system is tops, and the driving experience is like none other. The paint on the car is beautiful and I am trying to preserve this car because I do not think that there will be another like it. The body style commands attention, what can I say except that this car has earned the number one place from me!

I'm now 72 years old and have owned many fine nameplates in the past including BMW, Mercedes, Porsche and Audi. This car is an engineering masterpiece and a joy to own in its own right. I love top down cruising in the countryside with that smooth V-8 under my right foot. Turning on the Mark Levinson to my favorite tunes adds to the pleasure. It's a style that grows on you not unlike the new Mercedes SL, and for a lot less money. When it is replaced next year I doubt there will be another quite like it.

Review_Title: Been a dependable car, but needs to be driven.
Review: If I don't drive the car for3-4 days, the battery runs down.I don't drive it enough, so I connect the battery to a battery maintainer that alleviates the problem.
Was very disappointed in this model. Ride was rough. Hard to get in/out. I'm no longer considering this model

The Lexus SC430 is an extremely misunderstood commodity in the automotive community. I have owned over two hundred cars and owning two of these has been an utmost pleasure.  Solid reliability and silky smooth quietness and virtually year round convertible use capability with lovely HVAC and heated seats. My first one took me to  165k miles before a newer example with only 50k miles drew my attention away. In the middle I owned a G37 Convertible which was very noisy and harsh compared to the lovely SC430. Don't think of this car as a sports car, this car is a luxury touring car. I'd honestly go anywhere in it.  These cars have aged well and I receive compliments daily, fit and finish are next to none, Toyota maintenance costs are reasonable as I have the car serviced at the Toyota dealer. Float down the highway with the stereo on and let your stress fade away...

Review_Title: Put the top down and go
Review: The car is easy to drive and everything that counts is easy to do or figure out quickly. The speed may be too much for the cornering so you learn quickly how to use the transmission to break. The run flat tires are terrible so get rid of them immediately. The automatic aspects of putting the top down are outstanding; in 20 seconds you are ready to go. The comfort and details are what you would expect from Lexus. A definite buy. UPDATE 2017: Still loving the car. A great benefit of small cars is they are easy to wash and wax, every month I update the finish with a detail wax spray. I always get compliments on this car. UPDATE 2018; 86K mileage, runs great and still fun to drive. Be prepared for mileage replacements to start, can be expensive.

I think the GPS is very intuitive and I've never used one.  I activated the bluetooth without the manual and it definitely works when the car in moving.  Hearing the other party is much better than my other car's bluetooth hook up.  I even like the token back seat that holds my son until he'll move to the front.  I love the headlights that go around the corner and the seats that fit like a glove.  I'm not thrilled that it asks for premium fuel but that's not a big deal.  I can't wait to drop the top this summer but love the fact that the PA winters are not harming a soft top while waiting for summer to come.

We got this car mostly due to the hardtop convertible feature.  The design and comfort are very nice while the performance and drive are lackluster. The car seemed to have been designed for an older driving population who want the look of a convertible in a Lincoln Town Car frame.  The technology and nav system is very counter intuitive with the entire system disabled while driving, so you'd have to park the car before using your nav system or Bluetooth phone.  Be careful of Lexus dealers lying to you about this feature.    All in all, this car is somewhat disappointing but if you're looking to have a convertible look that drives like a sedan, then it's the right car for you.
Super vehicle. Amazingly quiet even with top down.  Acceleration and braking are great, as billed in the literature.  A real lux sport coupe on winding roads.  A fantastic ride.

Review_Title: Your only decision will be which color.
Review: This is my first Lexus, and driving the SC 430 goes well beyond my most extreme expectations.  It has the silkiest shifting transmission I have ever experienced on a car, and the ride is like floating on air.  Ultra-comfortable front seats, and plenty of power help to complement the other features of this car.  Test one, and compare it to the other cars in this segment.  Your only choice will be which color combination to get.
Everything about this car has been perfect!

This car has always been a dream car for me, never thought i would own one. We purchased two Lexuses at the same time,   my SC 430  and my partners GS 450 Hybrid.    We chose Lexus again because of design/build quality  but also equally because of  customer service. The fit and finish of both vehicles is outstanding, and the driving performance is awesome.   I wanted a luxury convertible, but my requirement was  HARD TOP.  That leaves me with either the Lexus or the Mercedes. I chose Lexus.

Visibilty of the nose and rear end drops off when parking. There is a lack of any bumpers on doors to avoid dings. The paint quality on the exterior is not as good as it should be. I am MOST disappointed in the exterior paint. After purchase I had some zinc oxide rub off on the interior arm rests. Lexus was completely at a loss as to what to do. I am sure other people buying a Lexus convertible will also use sunscreen and have a similar problem. It is very quiet and does not beat you up when the top is down.

After only 6k iles I have 11 paint chips on the hood of the vehicle. Lexus claims road hazard. I say every stone or pebble on the highway must be hitting me. Only 1k miles on highway.  How is it possible. Chrome around grill vs painted plastic. Two chips there as well!  Very disappointed!
Terrific styling, not seen too often.

Unbelievable ride, grace and class.  Run flat tires are silent even with the top down.  I have never owned or driven anything like this. Looked at all other options but there is no equal for the money in elegance ride and overall feel.  This car is made for running tropical moonlight nights with the top down.  Top up it is not recognizable as a convertable.  My only wish is gas mileage was a littee better, getting 19mpg @ 2000  on the odometer.

I've driven many luxury cars, and this by far is my favorite because it is an affordable sports car with a sophisticated, rich look about it. It drives amazing, with absolutely no road noise, which a lot of the other sports cars had. This is my second SC 430, and thus far have had no issues with anything.

Traded a convert Mercedes for this and am extremely satisfied. Excellent ride even with the run flat tires. Elegant styling and great handling. I would have to say that the Mercedes in this price range do not compare to this vehicle. I have owned it about a month and have not found anything I dislike about it

I have loved my Lexus SC 430, it handles great, and is so fun to drive. I have had not one problem with it. I will buy another one soon, but, for now, it's amazing how new and beautiful it still is! Go for it, it's a great car!

Review_Title: Awesome luxury in a Sports car
Review: Awesome drive.  Comfort and luxury in a sports car!  Not a commonly seen vehicle that turns heads.  Good gas mileage for its type.  Attention to detail is spectacular.  Hard-top convertible is unique and works flawlessly.

For a retired senior, it's the perfect car for the second vehicle now that the kids are out of the house.  Makes you feel young again.  Auto top down mechanism is great and it rides almost like a sedan while having the nimbleness of a roadster.

My recent frustration with an X5 and a 745  sent me on a mission to check out Lexus. Every experience I had had with 5 other Lexus cars was great so I went looking for an suv and an LS 430. Well when I saw this matador red, chrome wheeled beauty I was smitten. This is a great car that no one seems to pay any mind to. Beautiful styling, great comfort, world class fit and finish, quiet ride top up and top down and Lexus reliability make this car bulletproof. The only flaw is the seat belt access but why quibble. This car has it all and a great value in the market place. I have never enjoyed a car like this one. This is one sweet ride.

We were blessed to buy a Lexus SC430 four weeks ago. I love driving it, and I especially love the looks and stares that I get from the special color of the Pebble Beach version! It's wonderful on the road; it handles beautifully! I can't wait until the temperatures are warm enough for me to put the top down!! Way to go Lexus!

The 2006 is my second SC430. I traded my 2003 for the newer model. I have owned many proformance cars including Porches, BMW's, Mercedes,Ferrari and Corvettes. It is not the quickest or the fastest, but is definately the most comfortable to drive, especially on long trips. I enjoy owning this car.

This automobile is by far the best I had in my 24 yr driving experience. Very well balanced ride, of course quality wise I can't compare it to any of the above mentioned cars. Attention to every detail in a interior is uncompromising. Very powerful, torque engine and most importantly NO WIND @ 90 mph on freeways! Just love it!
Exhilarating!!!  From the moment I took the keys, my life changed.  This car looks sexy & handles far better than I expected.

I love this car it's everything a convertible could be and exactly what I wanted. Large enough to be comfortable, sporty enough to be the talk of the parking lot. Interior detail is lavished with all that is lovely, outside is curvaceous and innovative. The top feature is intriguing to all who witness it, it's truly convertible in every sense of the word. Sporting 20" Chromes with run flat Toyos it drives like a dream, all on-lookers drool. Some convertibles are made for the regular drivers - they needn't be speed demons, corner huggin', fastest off the line to enjoy -for those of you who always wanted a convertible - this car is for you.  It's BODACIOUS Fun Drivin' Fun To Own

What could go wrong, it's made by the most reputable and reliable car makers in the world.   Forget about the bucket seats, everyone knows it's a car made for 2 people and that is fine by me!  We bought it for the reliability and quality of the car.

Review_Title: The Best in Luxury Convertible cars
Review: Dont compare it with Porsche or MB, they are different animals. If you want to feel the engine, the road and handling of a real sport car go with a Porsche or SL500 or if you have the bucks go with a Ferrari but if you want to have a quasi Sporty convertible car with real luxury, the best reliability in the market, good power (60MPH in 5.8sec.), excellent comfort, outstanding stereo sound, premium amenities and you want to keep the best value in a car the SC430 is the car! Some people, disapprove the back seat, but to me it's a good thing, why? Because my insurance is not considering my SC like a Sport Car that normally is 50% more expensive expensive than a regular car because the 4 seats.
Safe. Classic. It's feels like an airplane cockpit.
You may pay what is a slightly higher price, but the car runs and runs and runs!

Review_Title: Best car I have ever owned
Review: Fun to drive.  Lexus service outstandibg

Review_Title: Worth it - if you only watch the top go down!
Review: The acceleration is incredible!  Watching the top go down is almost as good as sex (almost)!!Even with it being an 11 year old car - the interior is luxurious - black leather with the burled dark walnut is elegant.  The exterior is beautiful (not as striking as my 1999 SC400 - but excellent).  Everything work like it did the day it rolled off the showroom floor.The only downside is that it isn't exactly top down weather - so I'm impatiently waiting for the weather to turn.Of course - the only drawback is the lack of up-to-date electronics.  Can't download my contacts from my phone.  It handles "1-touch" dialing - but you have to manually enter your top 10 phone numbers, but the Bluetooth still works well with the phone.  The navigation system is okay, but needs updating (need to go on-line and find an upgrade DVD.  I updated it with a wireless back-up camera - tough to see behind you without it.  I get about 22 mpg and it only had 83000 miles on it when I bought it!UPDATE - July 2018I now have 119,000 miles on the car and it is still as good as the day I bought it.  One small item...I developed a small drain on the  battery that I can't trace down.  I installed a device that disconnects the battery when the voltage falls below 12V.  When you step on the brakes, it reconnects that battery and starts the car.  The alternator then recharges the battery.  If I drive it every day, it is fine, but I only drive it about once a week and that's when the battery saver device kicks in and starts the car - a real life saver.  I was also able to find an up-to-date Navigation DVD to update the onboard  navigation system.  This car is best when you're able to drop the top and take if for a run on a windy country road.  The car still turns heads when you are in a parking lot and drop the top - I still find myself asking my wife to sit in the driver's seat so I can watch the top go up and down.  I installed a Sirius-XM radio and can now cruise with my favorite tunes.  Still love this 14 year old car!!!!

I bought my dream car in 2003,a brand new 2004 SC430. Among other disappointments, I have rust problem. The alloy wheel is rusting out. The body also have many bubbles, under is rust. It is so disappointing. I did not expect it from a Lexus.

I purchased this vehicle used and sold my 1999 Mercedes SL 500.  This car is a pleasure to drive in every sense.  I wish that they would take out the back seat and place a self like Mercedes. Otherwise outstanding.
I love the design, comfort and hardtop/convertibility ease.  Plenty of power while not a race car.

I love driving my SC 430.  I also love the attention I get when I'm driving, anywhere.  I also own a Dodge Durango, but when I'm driving it, I don't get nearly the respect from other drivers that I do when I'm driving my SC.  It is really a glamourous vehicle that is apparently deceiving.  Other drivers will pull next to me, idle at the stop light, and think they'll be able to take off and get in front of me.  Ha!!  My baby has GET UP!!!  Every now and then I get to just blow her out, with the top down; the ride is incredibly smooth and intoxicating.
This car has incredible brakes! It will stop on a dime! It corners well and handles well and is a dream to drive. The steering is quite sensitive compared to other cars.
Love the car.  Would consider buying another SC 430 in the future, if they ever come out with a 4-wheel drive version, as told to me by the dealer sales agent.

I waited a long time to buy the car of my dreams, and this car has proven to be beyond my dreams.  I get comments all the time about the car.  Driving with the top down and my long blonde hair blowing in the wind really gets some stares.  Love it.. love it.. love it.

Far better value than comparable BMW and MB convertibles. Automatic top is techno-marvel. Interior is Rolls quality. Body is beautiful and functional. Bought it one year old with 11k miles on E-bay to save $16k off sticker. Couldn't have spent 48k on better car. Highly recommend if you want ultra-reliable luxury convertible for reasonable price.

I purchased this car brand new about 1.5 years ago.  I've had lots of annoying problems with it ever since (too many to list).  I'm lucky to go 2 months before having to bring it back to dealer.  The car has more rattles and noises than a '79 corvette.  Dealer replaced a roof hinge that was squeaking so loud that the Mark Lev sound system couldn't drown it out!  They finally fixed that and the the passenger side started squeaking.  The driver's seatback had to be repaired for a clicking noise-- again, once that was fixed the passenger side started acting up.  Run flats are terrible! Thank God the car looks so good and the sound system is the best I've heard otherwise I'd junk this mother!
I love the ride , even with the run flat tires . It is a lot of fun to drive , the power , the smoothness on good roads , the looks . It will be a hard car to trade in when the time comes.

I have only had this car a week, but oh what fun! The run flats I think do give this car a ride a bit more impulsive over bumps, but the highway ride is still very quiet and smooth. I bought mine "used" 2K miles but it was essentially new. The tags were on the upholstery. This car does make people do 'Linda Blairs'. The colors and styling are a knock out. Mine is amethyst with the ecru interior and birdseye maple. People just love it.

As far as people complaining about the room in the back ,This car is a 2 seater not a family car t6hey only put 4 seats for insurance purpose, Wake up and smell the roses people the car is great.Even with roof down in trunk I still have room for my wifes and my weekend bags.

We made the appointment 2 weeks before, dropped-offed the car for 3 hours, then finally got a phone call to be told that the dealership didn't have the tires.  The car also has a few loose pieces of plastics, one of them found under the seat.  This reflects poor dealer preparation of the car before delivery.  The dealership, just as like any others, pushed hard to sell add-ons.  Paint already show minor chips on rear bumper.
great auto.  Does not beat you up.

I love it lexus delivers.  It's my toy to get away from the "real world" and have a symphony on the road!  It's the volkswagen I always wanted on steroids!  An indulgence well worth it 20 yrs marriage 20 years working and 20 minutes and the dealership had me out of there!!!!!

Plenty of room for 2 passengers. Very limited luggage space. Firmest ride of any vehicle I've ever owned. Comfortable driver seat. Not as quiet or as smooth as my Lexus LS 430.Easier entrance than most sports cars."Run flat" tires over $300 each run about 1500 miles. No spare tire.

I've had this car for about 2.5 years now, and I still love it.  The car has an UNBELIEVABLE interior and is soooo comftorable (unless ur sitting in the "back seats").  This car drives very well, but you can feel the bumps and potholes.  Very fast car and extremely fun to drive.  "Back seats" are only useful to put your bags or umbrellas.  The convertible hardtop aspect is great, especially for me living in New York weather.  Once I had a flat tire, and went to the gas station to get it changed, and they couldnt find the spare tire, so we went home and we realized that the tires were RUN FLAT- it was amazing; you could go up to 65 mph with a flat tire.

Review: I have owned 2 SC's. I have loved them both.  The new, retractable hard top gives me the best of both worlds. There is little road noise with the top up. The stereo is high quality. The car is the ultimate if you want a convertable. I didn't look for a car with big back seats and a huge trunk. It fits me perfectly, as all the instruments are within reach. Wow. What a ride! Everyone who drives it, loves it!

Unlike many drivers, I am a 23-year-old single male, but like everyone else I love it! The thing is like a portable amusement park. Also, I live in Georgetown and love getting eyed by all the hot girls-- their eyes light up. Though it's not as good as my baby bulldog, the attention is incredible. But the best moments are when you are all alone, driving fast on the highway.
Quiet, reliable, beautiful,Powerful, exceptional handling, fast (awesome),finest of quality everything about this vehicle is first class!!!!

Review_Title: Fabulous car for a 60th birthday gift
Review: This car makes me feel fabulous every time I get into it.  If you are having a bad day just put the top down and drive your cares away.  I have also had a Lexus GS and traded  a new LS on this car. I have been so surprized about the amount of trunk space when the top is up.  I have traveled for 3 to 4 weeks and had plenty of room for all my luggage, dog crate and everything else.  It also holds tons of groceries.  Even with the top down I have enough room for a weeks groceries in the trunk.  But, the best thing about the car is the smiles on my face when I approach the car, and slide into the seat.  Put the top down and the day turns into sunshine.

Review: Excellent performance vehicle.  Slightly sluggish until the engine kicks, then watch out.  Gas mileage better than expected (21 miles per gallon average).  Sharp looking car with the top down.  This vehicle gets plenty of stares.

Luxury luxury in a sports car. Hard to find. This baby is a bentley in disguise, but for a bargain. Xenon, run flats, navigation system, all leather, no plastic, even the dash. Don't forget the philharminic sound system.
Love everything about this car:  fun to drive, distinctive, sexy, and everything works.  A total pleasure.

Proud to be seen with the top down. Nice to be able to afford this great car. I get so many stares from other drivers. Other drivers try to accelerate faster than this car, but they are amazed how fast it is. I have to be very careful as not to drive too fast. It is like riding  a wild stallion and pulling back the reins so it will not run away with me.

The SC 430 is all we have come to expect from Lexus-well designed inside and out, a comfortable (if a bit stiff) ride and perfect workmanship.  The driver and passenger seats are reasonably high so the visibility and comfort are terrific for a sports car. We also own a 2003 430 LS so an added plus is that the controls are similar in the two cars.  Lexus service remains without peer.
fun, fun , fun to drive

My wife and just bought the Lexus SC 430. We bit the bullet. Boy are we glad. It is everything we exected.  The performance is fantastic. The looks you get every day is incredible. People just stop & look & kids scream "love you car". It is so quiet with the top down. The speaker system is better than my Bose at home. The scary thing is that it is not satisfied at going 70 or 80 miles and hour. We love it!

Review: I have owned them all and by far this is the best.  Porche, Mercedes, BMW, Audi, Jaguar.  BEST CONVERTIBLE AND BEST PRICE.

This car has been my one splurge, and it has been worth it.  I love this car, and I love seeing more women driving it. This back seat area is small, but I've gotten my grandchildren back there easily, and my shopping bags.  I love the 8 cylinder because it gives it so much pick up.  I love the hardtop because I feel safer than I would with a cloth top. There is no better exterior design; the interior design is luxurious; I've had another Lexus, and I love their reliability.  It's a man magnet! I never get tired of watching the hardtop going into the trunk with a push of a button.  It's a love fest!

Thus far I love my new vehicle.  It is comfortable and sporty looking.  When playing the radio, the stereo does not seem quite as dynamite as my LS 400 that I use to have.  This may be bacause it is in a smaller space with fewer speakers.  The sound is good but not as good.  I can tell that the paint is going to scratch really easy.  I have indigo blue (or it may be that it shows up more on darker colors).  Overall I love the car and I would buy it again in a heart beat.  It is a smooth ride with all of the classy features.

My 2004 Absolutely Red SC-430 is a dream to drive.  It performs with outstanding agility and finese.  As a coupe it is a typical Lexus, quiet, refined and quality build. As a convertible it is an eye-catching drive to drive.  Some of the best hours f my day are spent in the driver's seat of this suberb vehicle. With a red exterior and a saddle interior ot a day goes by without several people commenting on it's beauty. The "envy" factor has many eying the machine from near and afar.  Its quick and agile off the line and eats the vast majority of vehicles alive with it's outstanding engine and drive train combination.
very nice car in all ways,but tires and wheels are a problem.run flat tires can not be fixed--very stupid,also wheels are a little week for the way the car rides.

Review: This car is a winner

Overall I am thrilled about this car.  The stock handling can be improved significantly with new stiffer antisway bars from Daizen.  They make cornering much flatter, tighter and more controlled.  I have the runflat Dunlops which are jarring when hitting potholes.  I will replace with conventional tires when they wear out.  One other aftermarket item that makes the car sweeter is Luxlink.  It is a remote convertible operating system that uses the unlock button on the key to open and close the top.  No more holding the switch on the dash for 30 sec.  They are sold at Luxury Motorworks for $230.

Review_Title: JD Power #1 rated car in history
Review: If your looking for a smooth running V8 300 hp vehicle with zero defects, this is the one.

My SC430 is silver and provides an increcably quiet and smooth ride, and jumps with acceleration when needed.  The engineering is superb and I appreciate all the details, as well as the great Levinson sound system and fabulous interior.  I enjoy having what is both a great sedan and gorgeious convertible -- it's definitely a "babe mobile."

The SC430 combines the quiet refined class of the "usual" Lexus product, when the top is up, with a fabulous open air experience, complete with subtly rumbling exhaust pipes and a totally cool interior.  The total package is a great value..especially when compared with the "other" hardtop convertibles on the market. Try one....you'll be convinced!!

Review_Title: Wow the Neighbors, but Watch the Bumps
Review: SC430 offers the luxury car owner an uplifting experience. Make sure you won't be driving in a snowstorm or on a road surface that has not been recently repaved.The run-flats are poor performers on any surface other then what is shown in the alluring Lexus brochure. Solve this and it could be one of my all time favorites and I have been fortunate to have owned a 911C4, SC400, Delorean(well that's another story)Have a spare SUV in the garage, then wait for the great spring or fall day, crank up your favorite tunes on a sound system that is as good with the top off at 75 mph as when it's up, and enjoy what very few others will ever know.

My best car EVER! RIP at 332,000 miles!!! I bought my SC430 in October 2001 and had it until December 13, 2016, due to a freak accident in my own backyard! I changed the Alternator ONCE in May 2016 and the Starter and Pully ONCE in August 2016! I changed the timing belt THREE times at every 100,000 miles. Other than the usual brake change and service/maintenance, there were no major issues. I pray to have another car such as this. I cannot live without the refinement of this vehicle. Lexus, please and please in the name of Jesus, BRING BACK THE SC430!

This is my third SC430. My wife and I love this car. The stylish lines are timeless. The build quality is unmatched, the reliability is insane. I cannot believe that Lexus stopped building such an excellent vehicle. Their new converts can not compare.

Traded in my RX300 with this SC430 new in 2007. Three years & 34,000 miles later, I have not had any problems with this car. Black Sapphire exterior and Camel leather interior turns head anywhere I go. Had to change the tires at the 26000-mile mark. With depreciation and maintenance be ready to have a $1000 a month expense on this car. It's worth every dime!

Purchased this car used with only 7000 miles. This car has exceeded my expectations in all respects. The engineering, fit and finish are beyond reproach. The only concern is the run flat tires. I got the P.B. Edition and love it. I doesn't compare to Porsche, but wasn't designed to do so. A great car for me at 66 yrs.

I love driving this car but I have serious problems with tires separating from the rim.  Within the last 4 months, I had to replace 3 tires at $400 each.  The car does not even have 15K on it.  I am an experienced driver but have never experienced such a problem.  I believe that the Dunlap run flat tires are of an inferior quality and need improvement.  Lexus dealer informed me that these tires are much thinner on the outer portion of the tire.  Maybe that is the problem but we as consumers should not suffer from that!   When one buys a $65,000 car, he or she should expect quality including the quality of the tires.

Just bought a lightly used '07 with 4000 miles. Just love it! The interior stands up against the Mercedes SL while being $40k less. Wanted a luxurious, smooth ride, with pep when I want it. This car is absolutely perfect! And the reliability of Lexus makes it a real no-brainer!

I had recently bought the Lexus SC430 and I truly hate this car. I have the rare pebble beach edition too. The first problem was that my left headlamp fell off while I was driving on the highway. Lexus said that it was due to driver neglegance. Then my power top got stuck halfway closed they did replace it. Then my alternator went bad I've been through six already. Then three days ago my brakes let go coming up my driveway. The car is nice looking yes but its very unrealiable. Then my whole instrument panel stopped working. That cost me $1,100 dollars because it wasn't covered. I also have a Cadillac STS-V and that gets better mpg than the Lexus. Im trading this in for a most likely a Cadillac.
Great car!I am very happy with features and quality of this car.  Keep up the quality.

I really love my Lexus sc 430, it handles beautifully and I enjoy driving it.  I have no problems with it at all.  I purchased the car new and have replaced the tires at 25,000 miles which is to be expected.  I hope they do not change the style, it is just a great looking vehicle.
It is the car that you cannot keep your eyes off of. Perfect in almost every aspect.

This car is a refined sports car which may be too tame for some, but just right for others.  It does not offer the excitement of a 911, Viper or Z06, but it does have creature comforts and fit and finish which is beyond reproach.  Having owned many other roadsters, I can tell this is the one I'll keep for a while to come.

Have been driving Toyota/Lexus since first Corolla in 1986. Have also driven Camry, Highlander, Prius and ES330 models. Very happy with all. Purchased this 1-owner clean carfax SC430 model with 109k in October 2014 for not a lot of money. Now at 140k in August 2018 and not a peep out of it from a mechanical standpoint. Got rid of the run flat tires quickly, as the ride with them is much too firm. Happy with all season radials although no spare on board. The styling is timeless. The wife loves it.  Ride is and remains smooth, quiet and polished. And with the top down we tend to smile more. Many still mistake the car as new --- at 15-years-old now --- and consequently me as a rich man. Neither is the case. Only drawback is it's a little hard for me to get into and out of with its low stance, but that's likely due to my increasingly creaky bones and not an inherent isssue with the car itself. Would not hesitate to purchase one if the law of attraction happens to bring a nice one to your attention! 🚗

These cars were so ahead of there time in 2002. It is a great car overall and for a used convertible this is the best value you can get for a used convertible under 15k (2002 to 2004 used ones). Do not use in snow at all. Not even once inch it will crash.My friend who had one told me this.It drives smooth and refined and its reliable. If you buya German used convertible you'll spend a lot in repairs. You won't with this. I don't have the run flats but I hear theyare a problem.The top is up and down in 25 seconds.

Runflat tires do cause a bit of hard ride. I hit a pothole without seeing it and it bent the rim very easily. Dealer wanted $600 for just the rim.  I average 18 MPG as it stated I would. No big deal coming from a Tundra with 13 MPG.  Convertible parts are very expensive.  Overall I do enjoy driving the car alot and will probably keep it until it dies out on me.  I haven't had any major mechanical issues at all with the car.

I bought my 2003 SC430 with 50k miles on it for $20,000. Everything is immaculate on this car, always serviced when needed. The drive does have that sport car ride to it due to the low profile RFT's. The sound system sounds amazing although it is very expensive to replace just 1 speaker at $320. The rear seats (golf bag holder) are useless for people to sit in. The trunk surprisingly does have decent space when the top is up. Being that the model is still the same as of 2010. I will upgrade some of the standard parts to the newest style.

I've always love to drive at night with the sunroof open.  This car blows a sunroof away.  Amazing power.  Dead silent cabin with top down at high speed.  Completely exhilarating.  I look forward to the commute to work.

Received this beautiful little red car for my 65th birthday. I fell in love just looking at her but when I took her out for a drive... that was it. Had a Corvette when I was in my 30s and this car far surpasses it in feel, looks and fun to drive! I feel like I've gained 20 years back. Never too late to have fun on the road.
Owned several Corvettes, a TR-6 and an Austin Healy.  This car takes the cake.  Sometimes I have to look for things to do since no time is spent repairing this one.

I purchased this vehicle used and it had been serviced by a Lexus dealership. I immediately put Pirelli all season non run flat tires on it with a new spare tire.  What a difference; it is now the perfect retractable hardtop; rides just as nice as my previous ES 330.  Could not have imagined how many looks we would get sitting in traffic or driving down the interstate!

The front end is non existent and you will end up replacing $400 every time you hit a pot hole. It is beautiful, great acceleration, but the tires and wheel covers will be replaced numerous times.  The tires which never go flat get lousy overall mileage.  It costs over $400 just to put snow tires on in the winter.  That is without buying them at $400 a pop.  So if you have thousands to waste because the front end was made for a show room this is a great car.

With top up, it is difficult to look backward to park because of the hump.  Run flat tires are a very hard ride, and not suitable for winter- pothole/cracked streets.  When tire hits pothole, you will need to replace tire and rim for approximately $1,000 each.  I replaced three tires at a cost of $3,000 in one year.

Recently purchased a 2003 SC with 13k miles and have driven it 4k in 6 weeks. Initial impressions, this is the best car I've ever owned and fun to drive. Only complaint I had was the runflat tires that came with the car. The runflats were noisy and rode very rough. Changed to Pirelli PZero Nero's and WHAT A DIFFERENCE.. Quiet and smooth, like a different car. Opted for no spare and purchased a small tire pump and repair kit for $20.

Yes, it does not handle like a porsche, but who cares! Top up or down you will not find a more enjoyable, relaxing cruising experience.  Not a single problem in 3+ years of driving attests to the overall quality of the car. Cheaper than quite a few of the alternatives and still a car that gets approving looks and compliments just about any day that I drive it.
A fun and reliable vehicle that I have had almost no problems with.  When the speakers were damaged by my son, the dealership replaced them at no costs. Lexus service is outstanding.
Driving this car is an enjoyable experience. It is very comfortable, has plenty of power. Fun to drive with the top down. Ride is smooth except over bumps.

Despite the recall on the tire valves, and the battery that could never charge, and the broken 6 disc CD changer, this is an awesome car.  The closest thing to a lemon that toyota has ever built, but i'm in love with it.

I LOVE THIS CAR!!! I have had it for two years.  My ultimate dream car.  Could own a maserati, SL500, whatever, I DON'T WANT THEM!!! I will keep my SC forever!  I would recommend a lexus to anyone, this is my summer car and the GX 470 is my winter car.

I have owned my SC 430 for over a year now and love it. You mentioned your editor's size, well I'm 6 ft 4 inches and weigh in over 350 and have plenty of room. I have driven it 2000 miles on some trips and never feel cramped. The only addition I added was a set of custom chrome rims and low profile high speed rated  tires and the proformance and handling is outstanding.So overall the style, performance, handling and luxury features are GREAT!! Rich

I owned a GS 300 a few yrs. ago and sold it to drive a practical car. I bought a Yukon.  Every time I saw a sporty Lexus I longed for another one.  I stopped by to check out what Lexus had in the way of sporty and fell absolutely in love with the sexy looks of the SC 430. I knew I was in love!  I bought it after only 1 test drive and have loved it every day since.

we use the car mostly on weekends..it's lot of fun and has great wow factor..mant many times we've been waved to, honked at, and given smiles and shoutouts.  i would urge not getting the runflat tires..hard riding and had to wait weeks for a replacement

This was by far the best car I've purchased yet. It is a real head turner. I have even had people follow me nerve rackingly too close, just so they could get a good look at the car. The car has a smooth engine that just purrs like a huge jungle cat. The hardtop that folds into the trunk is very convenient. When my husband took the top down one day while sitting in the parking lot of our son's school, the kids who were suppose to be awed by the lecturing firemen who came for an outdoor assembly, turned their heads at our car instead and began shouting oohs and aahs. We were embarassed we disrupted their lesson.

The Lexus SC 430 is a stylishly-designed hard-top convertible that meets all of the lofty expectations Lexus usually commands.  It is quiet, powerful and richly-appointed (i.e. 9-speaker Mark Levinson CD/stereo, DVD navigation system, burled walnut interior), and has all of the beautiful detail so typical of the Lexus brand.  However, as a high-performance (300 hp V-8) convertible, it is truly unique.  Less expensive than the comparable Jaguar, Mercedes and Cadillac offerings that are its primary competitors, this car is hard to beat.
UI love this car it is quite when yiou

column1: drive and it has a lot of cool gadgets

Review_Title: it's wonderful to drive an sc430 daily
Review: This car is wonderful to drive and gives you much comfort if you are a busy, hardworking person. It is especially lovely to drive with the top down. Nothing has gone wrong at all.

Review_Title: The Best Car I have ever owned
Review: I just love my car...I have enjoyed this car

column1: more than any vehicle I have ever owned...
including  BMW  and  Cadillac's.  I have
owned them all.  This is the best!   The
Service is the BEST!!!!  What can I say....buy
a Lexus....you wil Not be sorry.

Review: No comparison to any other vehicle we have driven. Interior design is amazing, and the drive is the best. We even pick up our 7-year old from school and YES, she can sit in the back seat. The passenger seat just has to be forward a little. Does not drive, feel or sound like a typical convertible.  We couldn't be more pleased with this choice.
Performs great.  Style is beautiful.

column1: It is good to know when I need the
power it is there.  Most fun I've had
in a car since my 58 TBird.

Review: I am locked into buying an M3 BMW. Twotest drives later I am wondering if a 61year old "car nut", can live with theday to day adventure of a lurchy,non-seamless but sporty SMG transmissionand a fairly rough ride on all but thesmoothest road surfaces. On the day Iwas supposed to consumate the purchase,my wife said why don't we drive theLexus? I was shocked as to how nice itwas in every detail. I have hadPorsches, MBZs, Zs, BMWs, an Audi, anAlfa. I drive alot and being in a ruralarea I can enjoy a car. This car is apleasure. It is comfortable, sporty,quiet and the best sound and navigationsystem I have ever experienced.
This vehicle is absolutely wonderful.

column1: Could not be better.

Review: very nice iterior design,exellant navegation system.
THIS IS A GREAT CAR...IT LOOKS

column1: GREAT....FEELS GREAT....AND DRIVES GREAT

Review: I owned a 1997 Lexus SC 400 for six

column1: years No problems except a new battery
because I left the trunk open.
This new 2002 SC 430 has a rattle in
the passengers side. The dealer has
been trying to fix it for the last year.
The last effort two days ago is
uncertain.

Review: THIS   CAR  HAS  A   GREAT  FINGER

column1: TUCH  NAVIGATION   SYSTEM

Review_Title: Not a sports car, a cruiser.
Review: The quality, reliabilty and workmanship on this car is outstanding, the interior is beutiful. The engine is quiet and powerful but it just doesn't like to rev up. It shifts into a higher gear to soon when you are accelerating. The only way to get full acceleration is to shift manually. The run flat tires are so firm that you'll know the location of every manhole cover in town. We joke that you can feel it when you cross the white line. It just doesn't drive like a sports car. More for highway driving.

This is the best car on the market in my book.  I was initially looking for a small sedan (BMW 530i or Lexus GS model).  Instead, ended up going home with this model 2 weeks later. I love it. It's perfect as long as there are only 2 riders.  I have my top down whenever possible--this is made easy by the fact that it only takes a button to drop the top.

Review_Title: Second SC430 after owning a Mercedes
Review: This is my second Lexus SC430 I liked the first one so much I bought another one even the same color.  The quality is better than any car I have ever owned.  The drive and performance are different than a German car, not quite the feel for the road or the handling however the relaiblity far makes up for any performance differences. I owned a 2000 Mercedes which was a service nightmare.  Am very happy with the Lexus would not consider buying another Mercedes.

After owning 4 previous LS, SC, and ES versions of this now legendary mark, I am pleased to finally have a convertible available in the lineup.  I believe Lexus hit their mark with a thoroughly delightful power machine.  The quality is obviously Lexus and the design is an eye catcher every time it leaves the driveway.  My Indigo pearl with custom lexus wheels seems to be the attention getter of the neighborhood.  Power is sufficient but not over the top, handling is solid but lacking against the likes of BMW.  Far superior in every way over my previous Jaguar!

I can tell you that the SC has been the car I have enjoyed, it is fun!  Comming from an LS430 I was used to a very soft ride. I would say the SC's suspension is the equivielent to most German cars, and wonderful!!  If you are coming from a Porsche or BMW you will think the ride is a bit softer than what you are used to, if comming from a cruiser then you may think it's a bit tight, either way 24 hours and you will be in love with the SC. Seats are much more comfortable the German competitors, and engine is quiet which is nice during long drives. The car has personality and carisma that few cars have.  Love it!

When we purchased the sc430 we had to almost wrestle another couple for the keys . People beg for rides,whistle often and generaly thumbs up this curvaciously styled auto. It is a Fine car, well built, solid and QUIET; that does everyday driving with a graciousness, good manners and slippery fast acceleration. We fabricate excuses to take the car for a ride-this one is a keeper .

Purchased this vehicle after test driving the Jaguar XKR.  Not as fast as the Jag, but blew it away in the comfort, value,and ergonomics dept.The peace of mind of the hardtop and the serenity when the top is helped my decision.

This car is just a lot of fun to drive.  It is smooth, comfortable.  The dashboard is well laid out and convenient to use.  The navigation system is outstanding. The top retracts with great style. This car is beautiful to see moving or parked.
I love this car, my 4th Lexus.  Thestyle is sharp, the interior comfortableand very classy looking.  Holds the road great.

Review_Title: Lexius  sc 430 zero to sixty in 5.9 sec.
Review: Having owned several exotics inclusice

column1: of Porshe Jag and mercedes the Lexus
Sc430 has been an incredible experience.
The elctronic hard top and the fit
makes for two seperate and distinct
vehicles. The custom sound systim
compensates for top up or down driving.
The V-8 and structure makes for a solid
driving experiance.  Zero to sixty in
5.9 seconds is exilerating!

Review: Overall I no-longer consider the SC430 a sports car. It is a very fine, very reliable, high quality, innovative, high value SPORTY car. It is not a sports car like a Porsche, etc.

I am still thrilled to hop in, put the top down and rocket down PCH in this car. The open cabin is quiet enough at 80 mph to speak hands-free without raising my voice and the ride is silky smooth nimble handling PLUS not a bit of a breeze ruffles my hair (air dynamics MIRACLE!). The only complaints I have heard regard cargo space and I find sufficient space with the run-flat tire option (no spare.) The rear seats are a visually stunning way of adding stowage. The SC430 is a dream car with Lexus reliability, Bentley luxury, Aston Martin panache and Porsche speed and handling. I plan to keep it FOREVER!!!

The SC430 should be car of the year, every year.  It's a pleasure to drive and unlike other top end sports cars there are few on the road.  One problem are the run flat tires.  Only the dealership in orlando carry them and they are $295 each.

Review_Title: Great car but for rattles @  clicks in w
Review: The car runs well and has a crisp

column1: suspension relative to the LS430.
Handling is better than the GS400 I
just turned in. Car has annoying
rattles and clicks that the dealer has
tried to fix. It will go back again!
Could use more legroom in rear. Rear
seats are for packages only.

Review: THIS CAR HAS QUIET, SMOOTH, AND RESPONSIVE POWER. IT TURNS HEADS AND COMMANDS LOOKS EVEN WHEN PARKED. COMFORT, LUXURY, AND SPORTS APPEAL ALL ROLLED INTO ONE EXCELLENT VEHICLE.

I took my Lexus SUV into the service department for it's 3000 mile checkup and while it was being serviced I strolled around the showroom and also the car lot.  That is when it happened.  I fell in LOVE.  It was sitting there in the sunlight with the top down gold and beige interior and gold body. I felt it was calling my name.  I took it for a short drive and knew I had to have it.  My husband drove the SUV home and I, at 69 years old drove home the most magnificent auto I have ever owned, an SC430. I am having the most fun in my senior years with my wonderful car.

The best automobile I have ever owned.I have owned a 72 Pontiac GTO,78 Datsun 280Z,86 Saab 900Turbo,88 Porsche 928,97 Toyota Twin Turbo Supra and the car I currently ownn, a Lexus SC430.It is quick,quiet and responsive with the best standard audio system on the market.Priced slightly above a Mercedes SLK and substantially below an SL whichcomes closer to the SC.I'm thrilled with my SC430 and can not see how Lexus can top this automobile.
after over a year that i got this sc430, i still have the same feeling every time i drive it. fascinating.thrilled.

I love cars, buy one every 2-3 years,and have always wanted a sports car. The Lexus 430 SC is truly the car of mydreams.  It handles beautifully (exceptin the snow), feels comfortable as wellas luxurious, and I can put the top downin less than one minute.  I tell peopleI'm not buying another car until I can'tget in this one any longer.  There isnothing bad to say; even the gas mileageis acceptable.
This is my second SC. Replaced a MB SEC

column1: 500 AMG and will continue with the
Lexus nameplate because of reliability
and quality.

Review_Title: Great car for a tall person
Review: Tried all the sports cars and for the

column1: tall person-this is the car.  A lot of
thumbs up on the highway.  You won't be
incognito.  Just fun to drive.

Review: In about nine inches of water on the

column1: road the car stalled and the engine
blew. Lexus could not explain it and
refused to cover it.  Apparantly in any
situation where there is water over the
lowest point of the bumper it scoops
into the engine compartment.  This
appears to be a serious design defect.

Review_Title: The best car I've ever owned
Review: This is a great car, tight, reliable, posh, thoughtfully executed. Everything about it suggests quality-- the finish, looks, touch of the controls. I owned the previous model (SC 400) which was also very sexy, but harder to control--road feel, handling, and control of this car are greatly improved. Run flat tires occasionally transmit too much of uneven roads to driver. I look forward to enjoying this car for years to come.
Great Car!  Can't beat the looks and

column1: the gizmo's.  Real power and
performance to boot in a well thought
out and executed vehicle.  Great value
compared to more expensive SL 500 (had
one earlier on too!)

Review: after 3 911s an sc400 and an ls400 -

column1: this care is the very best.  The
retractable hard top makes it the best
of both worlds.  Fit and finish are
perfect.  Adequate space with top up.
The engine is smooth with power plus -
handling sweetly.

Review: For a performance convertible this has to be the most boring for the dollar.  Our Volvo S60R T5 is more fun, and a better value.  It pales in comparison to the Z06 for a performance vehicle.

I bought my SC430 during the early release.  I now have 20,000 miles on it and have had absolutely no problems with it.I like the style, what a car for the price.I use it as a two seater, so no complaints about the back seat.  I find the storage sufficient even with the top down.I would recommend a slightly tighter front suspension.The run flat tires have been great and holding up much longer than predicted.Best car for the price in it's class.
Car is absolultely stunning in every way.  My friends love the value you get and all the neat gadgets.  Fuel economony is okay, but the ride is well worth going to the pump more often!

Review_Title: Fun Car, Great Value, Interior Rattles
Review: Fun car to drive. You feel special with the top down. Nice power, great sound, convenience of automatic roof is great. Wouldn't want to drive this car on long trips, its a bit cramped. Luxurious feel.

Quite simply, its the best car I have ever owned---and that ranges from a Miata to an E-class.  Luxury, reliability, performance.  For those of us that don't go on that curvy roadside road but are suburbanites with varied driving habits, its the perfect 2 seater.  Needs a better trip computer, and the run flat tires are so-so for the winter, but wow, whata car!

Dollar for dollar, simply the best hardtop convertible in the world.A fast, smooth,ultra-luxurious and comfortable convertible with cool distinctive retro-futuristic styling and an awesome sound system.Build quality and luxurious ambience is superb - superior to cars that cost tens of thousands more

Overall Review:This is the best car I've owned...and currently I own two Mercedes (E3204Matic Wagon & C280). The car has an anvil like feel and the engine power never seems to end. The high-end quality of the interior and its overall fit and finish are much superior to Mercedes...which seems to have gone down hill in the past several years (lots of ill fitting plastic and visits to the mechanic). Also, my 11 month and 3 year old's car seats fit in the back seat quite well for weekend drives to the Beach.

Car is perfect - complaints about trunk space...all convertables have this problem.  No big deal.  I like the back seat.  It may be small, but if needed someone can squeeze for a quick ride.  It is also conveient for extra packing - ie groceries. Overall - highly recomend
Fun to drive, great acceleration, good gas mileage, great sound system, only minus not much trunk room.
Nothing but good things to say.  I

column1: would buy another one.

Review: The kind of luxury driving experience you always dream of.  The kind of convertible you can drive for six hours with the top down, or all day with it up.  Fit and finish rivaling european cars that cost $30,000 more.
This car is absolutely a dream !  Would

column1: never go back to a porshe after driving
this !

Review: EXCELLENT DEALER SERVICE. CAR RECEIVED

column1: WITH NO DEFECTS OR ADJUSTMENTS
REQUIRED. ALL EQUIPMENT WORKS AND NO
PROBLEMS. FIT AND FININSH ARE FLAWLESS.

Review: Having owned two SC 400's the purchase of a 2005 SC 430 was a natural and welcome happening.The car is so much fun to own and drive!Exceptional quality in comfort and style, power and dependability, the Lexus SC 430 fits our needs for sport and travel.Sure, its a bit short on rear seat room and luggage space but we consider it a sports car with a strong engine and smooth ride.The safety features and treatment of options are Lexus quality through and through.We are truely satisfied with this premium automobile.Wish they still made them!

I have previously owned a BMW.   I like this classy look of Lexus SC 430.  I enjoy the hard top convertible of this car.  This care gives me a quiet ride and fun to drive.  It is very comfortable to ride especially on a weekend trip.

The Lexus SC430 is a near perfect animal. It growls when you need it to but purrs all the time. This automobile is second to none in quality build, interior comfort and beauty, and all around elegance and class. When I drive my SC 430 (black with saddle, ooh la la) heads turn. She's a beauty. And amazingly, she's as much fun with the top up as down.  The perfect cocoon of silence and safety, the way the side of the door is higher than most cars gives you the feeling of being wrapped up in LUXURY!!!  I should know. I own a $160 thousand dollar Porsche along with thirty other luxury and sport cars. This car is my daily driver because life is too short to settle for less than the best.

I used to have a Mazda Miata back in 1990 and belonged to the Miata Club of America. Then went to a Mercedes 190 evo. loved the car but the fun factor was not there. Now this Lexus is a dream come true! Power, style, and reliability! Wow! By far the best car in the world for me. I love to just hop in and drive with no destination in mind. Looking to go from Toronto to Vancouver next summer. What other car would be as awesome?

I would like to see this sexy vehicle stay around. I cannot believe the plug is about to be pulled on this work of art. The only change I feel is necessary is the front end design. A couple minor changes could make this car very popular once again. The head lights cover too much space. I feel a change that resembles the front end of of the mercedes SL 550 would greatly improve its appeal. Do that and I'll buy another.

Review_Title: The Tires And Rims Are The Worst!
Review: The car is definitely fun to drive.  When the top is down, it turns heads.  The hard top goes up and down like a charm.  The reliability of the transmission and engine is superb.  But, the tires are the absolute worst!  The rims are soft metal and dent, scratch, and disfigure at every curb.  One pothole and your stomach ties into knots because you know that the sensor will sound and you will need to spend between $250-$425 for one, yes ONE tire. Everyone I meet loves the car and hates the tires.  Sure, you can put regular tires on the car, but where do you put the spare??  My friend just turned his in because of the tires.  One curb, one pothole and I reach into my wallet.

The best car I've ever owned, and I've owned 14 over the years including a corvette. Build quality and reliablity is the best of any car maker regardless of price. Beautiful looking, very fun to drive, top down is a breeze, comfortable, incredible sound system. I'm getting 25 mpg on highway. Not one problem in 2 years. Nav system is fun to use on trips. Plenty of go power, less than the vette, but as to build quality and reliability, no comparison. Rides smooth and quiet, yet screams if I step on it. This one's a keeper.

I have previously owned a jaguar sjs, m/benz 280sl, 350sl, 380sl. All great cars! However, the Lexus 430sc truly out performs all other cars I have ever owned or driven in this automotive category. The handling, the soft ride, the accessibility of instruments and the overall design puts this car in a class of its own. You can purchase a convertible with a retractible roof for more money, but you can't buy a better one. Lexus pays attention to detail. This car is quiet, great looking and fun, fun, fun to drive!
This is the best car I have ever owned.  It is far far better than either my Mercedes SL or Cabriolet.  It is beautiful and fun to drive.

This is my 2nd SC 430 and I absolutely love it! Its 8-cylinders give me confidence on the road, the convertible gives me a sense of freedom and style and the Lexus brand spells quality. I love the new 2006 colors, but will keep my pearl white for a while!! I like driving the original; the imitators are cute, but less classy/classic.

It is very comfortable to drive. If I was to sell it I would make sure that it is in the best conditions that it could be in. It is so comfortable that you could sleep in as soon as you sit in it. It drives very smoothly. The interior design is very beautiful to my eyes. The exterior design is wonderful to my eyes. It is fun to drive.

This car does not have a very good shock absorber system.  It is very rough on the road, but it gets about 26mpg, which is better than I expected on highway driving at fast speeds.   The car has a lot of power.

Best coupe convertible ever.  More roomy than XLR or AMG 55 and better appointment and craftmanship than both of those.  The cockpit is relaxed and functional.  None of the convertibles tested would allow one to go down the highway with the top down and be able to talk without shouting and to listen to the stereo except the Lexus SC 430.  We love ours and I am 6'2" and sit comfortably in the passenger seat.   The passenger seat reclines to allow short naps on long trips.  Not doable on the XLR or the MB AMG.
I've been driving for 60 years, have had at least 20 different cars and the same no of different makes. This is the best..

I traded in my 911 for this car. While I miss the responsiveness of the 911, I won't miss the hassles with ownership, repair costs, etc. The SC430 is a pleasure to dive. The build quality is outstanding. I have the top down all the time unless its raining or sunny and over 90 degrees.

I have never had so much fun driving a car. It is smooth, comfortable and just a treat to drive.  I have had trouble putting the key in the ignition a few times and will bring this to the attention of the dealer. Probably something I am doing wrong, because there is nothing else wrong about this car.  I love it. Getting a combined 19.8 miles per gallon, city & Highway

Review_Title: Love it, Love it, Love it
Review: I was driving on the interstate one day when a SC430 passed me up.  I didn't know what kind of car it was but was immediately drawn to the shape - I sped up to get closer and took a really long look.  My love affair with my current vehicle was all over from that point on!  Within 3 months, I was a proud owner of a crystal gold with saddle leather SC430 and I have never regretted it.  Not a day goes by that I don't get at least one compliment on my car, thumbs up signs from people in their cars next to me at red lights or people speeding up to get next to me on the interstate.  I find the backseat perfect for my purse and my umbrella and the trunk holds plenty of groceries. Don't wait...

Have had my SC430 for three days now.  The wife and I love the power, and the comfort.  We DID manage to stuff our three year olds in the back 'seats' for a few trips around the block.  They loved it, but I'm cure child- cruelty laws were being broken...  Remember, the rear seats are for insurance-lowering purposes only.

The car is fun to drive. Smooth, yet powerful. You can't feel the trans shift up or down. The cabin is quiet, and the sounf system is impressive with the speakers placed juast right. The top folds quickly and queitly into the trunk. Road noise is not a problem when talking with the top down. One drawback is that the runflat tires are somewhat noisy. Occasionally you can feel the pull from one side to the other.

Great driving, beautiful automobile.  This car is so much fun, we will keep it for years.  Yes, the backseat is too small.  Yes the cup holders need improvement.  But who cares!  This is one great car!
