The combination of the performance, luxury and reliability is top notch. No, it does not handle like a BMW540, but beats it in all other ways.
This is the best automobile I have ever

column1: owned.  Lexus is simply the Best!

Review: Without exaggerating the GS430 is literally a dream on wheels. It is hands down the best car I've ever owned and I have owned quite a few. Its roomy and so reliable its scary. The performance is as awe inspiring as it is effortless. The car is smoother and quieter than offerings from Audi, Cadillac, Mercedes or BMW, not to mention more reliable.  The quality is simply remarkable. The more I drive it, the more Im impressed. Its not perfect but its a lot closer to perfection than I ever thought possible. The amazing thing is the LS430 is even better.

Review_Title: better car than mercedes and porsche
Review: I've had the pleasure to own a mercedes, porsche and lexus, and  found the GS430 to be a fantastic car. It never goes to the shop, it's incredibly fast and smooth, and it's a blast to drive.  Of course the Porsche is the best car for reallllly fast driving, but day-to-day driving, the Lexus is the winner.

I had just turned 17 and what to i get for my birthday a lexus gs 430, and I love it it has been lowered and i purchased rod millen motorsports mufflers and the ride and drive are excellent. I have never had a problem maintaining this vehicle and it is the funnest car i have ever driven
this 1 is a keeper i've had them i

column1: don't drive it much onily 11000 miles
on it but when i do it's a thrill the
more it sits in the garage the more i
want to drive it

Review: Great Performance without a hint of

column1: effort.  I was a BMW 5 series person
for the last 5 years and I'm very happy
to have made the switch to this car.

Review: I'm 6'7" and this car fits me the best of any car out there.  I test drove 3 BMW's(330, 540, 740), 2 Mercedes (C class, E class), & 3 Audi's( A4, A6[including all engine types], A8. Hands down, this one had the most room and just felt the best. And the 300 horses...Yee-haa! This is the best car I have ever owned. I slap on winter tires & have never had a problem in the snow.  I will trade in for a GS430/SC430 in the next yr

I had a '98 GS400, traded it in, got a GS430.  Is there another sport sedan I should be looking for?  The navigation and sound systems are terrible in E55 and M5.  Lexus has the best navigation system, bar none.  Touch typing a street name is much easier than rotating a knob through the alphabet!

Review_Title: Best car I have ever owned
Review: I usually purchase a new car every year, but this one is a keeper.  I have never been more impressed with a car.  After owning a Lexus you will never own anything else.

My first Lexus, WOW! fell in love just sitting in the passenger seat, after a drive just had to have it. I look forward to the drive to and from work, 37 miles each way. Its hard to say what I like best about the 430, the ride(it glides), the power(130 MPH, it drove as good as it did at 60), mileage (22.6 average), and that’s letting it have it's head , the look, the soft luxurious leather, with air flow through the seats, keep it up Lexus, this 430 will not be my last.

Wonderful combination of sportiness and luxury. Have owned this vehicle since new and have not had one problem with it. I considered the BMW 540 and the Mercedes 430 and felt this was the best buy plus the best combination of power, sport and comfort. I typically trade quickly but this one is hard to beat.

When I set out to get a new car, I had a few goals to meet. I wanted a V8 powered FR car with "IN YOUR FACE" attitude. And boy, I've got one. Now I actually look forward to seeing the red light. Why? Step on it and you know why. 3700LB car takes off with dire urgency.  I burned expensive Bridgestones in a few occasion(not recommended). Lexus quality is phenomenal. It is indeed the luxury car...with 300 ponies at your service.

As tame and humble as it may seem. This beast hungers for excitement. It's hard to be a consertive driver in this quite machine. Handling ride and upmost performance doesn't capture the far reaching words needed to describe the experance of the GS430. It wants to go and I do let it loose on occasion.

column1: It's cool knowing you can kick a punk driving a 5.0 Mustang in the dust.

Review: Love it!! A little hesitant off the line but still has excellent power. Great combo for someone who wants the best of both worlds with luxury and performance.                          Love Love Love  :)

Review_Title: I'd buy another one at the drop of a hat
Review: Let me first say that I am a career GM salesman!  I would have never in a million years bought a Lexus, but we traded it in and I bought it.  I LOVE the car!  The seats and the interior are what sold me on the car.  Thank God it was the V8 model...  it's powerful, sleek, and butter smooth.  The Nav and Mark Levinson audio system make trips a blast.  The true test is that I bought mine AFTER someone else put 75,000 miles of business use on the car and it's still tight as a drum and runs like a dream.  As I have a habit of running through a vehicle about every 6 to 9 months.  This time though, I think I'll keep my Lexus and park way in the back at work!

This is my 2nd GS.I first bought a 1999 GS 400. I was going to buy a 2002 Accord. Long story short the Lexus blew the Honda away. I loved the car so much I got a GS 430. The 2003 is a lot smoother than the 99. I have always been a fan of Lexus's, and their reliability has always been outstanding. This is a fast and fun car. I put Michelin pilot sport tires on and the car has excellent handling. I strongly recommend this car. I put 60K miles in less than a year and I drive hard. I have had no issues. Just change the oil and fluids.

I've been looking for a lexus for a long time and when i came upon this one I said to myself this is the one for me.The way it looked caught my eyes. and When i took it for a test drive i didn't want to go home without it. I would recommend this car to anyone who wants luxury and performance in one package.

Love this car in the dry warm weather.  Awesome performance, reliabilty, nav, sound system.  Just don't get caught in the snow with it.  Car came with Z Rated 17" Tires that are pretty much useless in the snow.  Also, tires are pretty loud on the dry pavement.

Awesome car to drive and faster than most sports cars out there.  The person, "Must get another car for winter by jhave001" who rated this car 1.9 has no clue what he's talking about.  He rates the performance 1.0 and reliability 1.0.  I don't think this person has ever drove the GS430 let alone be able to afford it.  He's one of those that drives the Ford Pinto, adds 22" Rims and adds a Boeing 747 Spoiler and thinks it's his Mercedes.
I really enjoy the GS 430 we have not

column1: had it that long but I think it is a
great buy.

Review: this car is perfect

Review_Title: The best car I ever had
Review: I had a 2000 GS300, and was extremely happy with it except that the whiny V6 left me wanting for more so for my next car I upgraded to 2003 GS430 with NAV, 17'' Wheels and Mark Levinson.  Performance is unreal, the only cars that beat me so far are the BMW M3, M5 and the Corvette and with (maybe) exception of the M5 none of them are nearly as luxurious as my Lexus.  Sound sysem is off the hook, if you turn it up a little you can see side mirrors vibrating a little with the music, and the NAV is super accurate and a cinch to use (unlike my dad's on his 745).  If you have $50K+ to spend on a car you will not find a better combination of luxury and performance.
It was a great car that i wish i could

column1: have agian

Review: Excellent

column1: Better than the 2 Mercedes I had in the
past.

Review: Great engine and acceleration, but the tires need to be bigger.  The 17" wheels are not sufficient to fill up the wheel wells and cannot fully handle the power and torque put out by the engine.
I have just recently purchased this

column1: vehicle and in my humble opinion it is
a fantastic peice of machinery. I love
the build quality and the ride of
silence. Thanks Lexus. I do not prefer
a tighter suspension I will leave this
mona lisa alone.! :)

Review: After about a year of research and test drives (comparing BMW, Volvo, Mercedes, etc.)I decided to purchase a black on black Lexus GS400.  No regrets.  Main factors in decision making were build quality and mix of performance and luxury.  I have since modified the stock suspension to improve handling characteristics.  I love the car even more now.

If you want a great luxury sport sedan, get the GS430...you won't be sorry.  We love this car!  Clarification...As for last review...The person who can't drive in the snow needs to get snow tires.  The 17 inch Z rated tires are SUMMER ONLY  -- read the users manual!  There is nothing wrong with the car!  Get the right tires! Only driver error in this case.  What exactly happened at your dealership?  Did you go in asking for free snow tires?  We've had fantastic service in Tampa Bay.  Again, no complaints what so ever.

Review_Title: Must get another car for winter
Review: If you are seduced to buy GS430, be prepared to buy another car for the winter. This one DOES NOT run even in 2 in of snow. Traction control is worthless. I have GS 400, Mercedes, BMW drive up my driveway 6 days after a snow fall, but my GS 430 got stuck repeatedly. WORSE dealership experience in my 25 years of driving. ABSOLUTELY unwilling to help. Be warned. BE very warned.
A well built car that is not being

column1: imprved as often as it's rivals BMW
and Mercedes Benz. Therefore lagging
behind in power and electronic
sophistication.

Review_Title: Time for Lexus to update the GS
Review: Picked up my 2003 GS in December of 2002.  Still have a host of issues with it from suspension rattles, ultra light steering, and road noise being picked up from the sunroof drain tube (have to keep sunroof shade closed at all times).  Car feels loose - almost as if the dies that make it are getting worn.  Time for Lexus to update the GS.
In over 40 years I'v owned 25+ new and

column1: used cars.  This is without a doubt the
best vehicle I have ever owned or
driven.  If your thinking about buying
a new or high dollar used car you owe
it to yourself to drive a Lexus GS.

Review: First one was a GS300, now driving a new GS430.  Absolutely love these cars.  The transmission is a bit hesitant on the GS300.  The 430 is much smoother in excelleration, and has a very nice punch.  Very satisfying G's in 0-60 accelleration :) Nav system is excellent, very good directions.  Points of Interest database could be better.  I really only use that to find a gas station.  Sound system is the best I've ever heard in a car.  It's a Lexus, it's got the best quality of any luxury car.  Give me a GS430 over a 540 or the LS430 any day!

Review_Title: Germans need to learn from Lexus.
Review: I've owned many cars in my life (Japanese and German) and this is by FAR, the most reliable car I've ever owned. Interior is great...clean, functional and with great quality. Power is ample with the GS430 (GS300 is WEAK!) and the best part is the quality, reliablilty and service from Lexus. Something that BMW and Mercedes can't touch! (How 'bout those BMW E46 M3 engine failures and Mercedes well know electrial problems? I know, I've owned both!)

I have to say that this car is just perfect, no problems yet, and Lexus reliabilty is just Top notch.. This car has so much torque down low and without even pressing the gas that much the car holds u in the seat quite firmly, and it is so tame when u want it to be.
I bought this car used and I must say

column1: it is an outstanding car.  Right NOW
performance under your right foot.
Quality is second to none - everything
looks and more importantly feels
expensive.  Need to pass someone?  It
does not matter what your speed is.
Just do it!!

Review: From the moment I took posession of this magnificent car, which resembles a "Faberge Egg" in styling and assembly perfection,I have been in awe.  Quiet, yet powerful, it is an absolute driving pleasure.  I have not had any problems with this vehicle to date and the experience I have had with the dealership servicing my vehicle has been exemplary.  Other car manufacturers need to take not and learn from this Lexus eperience.

I waited for 6yrs to buy this car and when I bought was not disappointed.I also looked closely at the 540i and M3. Nothing can beat the performance of the M3 yet nothing can beat the luxury and looks of a black/black GS430. And with all that luxury it is still quick enough to beat almost all comers from a stand still at the traffic light (including a 540i). . The 540 is a weak car in my opinion and is over priced. The M3 is too expensive to maintain but handles like a F1 racing machineThe GS is comfortable, fun to drive, the interior is rich, the Audio and Nav are just super and the quietness of the cabin is unparalleled.Lexus service is exceptional.
Built better than my 2002 CLK 430 Benz, Interior is heavenly.  Traded my 2003 BMW M3, enough said.
Built better than my 2002 CLK 430 Benz, Interior is heavenly.  Traded my 2003 BMW M3, enough said.
This car is awesone I traded my 2000

column1: GS 400 for 2005 GS 430 with all the
fixings.  This cars rocks.

Review_Title: Best new car I have ever owned
Review: 112,000 miles and only 1 repair (at 108,000 miles hood release cable broke). Wish Lexus would use Bose radio (Levinson sounds great but radio reception is only average).

This car brings a perpetual smile to my face every time I drive it.  Took me several months to find a late-model GS 430 that was well-maintained - can't afford a new one.  I'd much rather buy a 4-year-old Lexus than a new car any day. Used to have an LS 400, and while it was a great car too, it was almost too refined to be fun to drive. The GS 430 is all about driving excitement if you ask me. The GS 430 has a great balance between sportiness and comfort.  It filters out harsh road noise and vibration, while letting you know that it has 300+HP under the hood.  Works well for my family with two carseats in the back. The Z-rated tires are pricey and wear out quickly so budget for tires!

Car is quiet and a pleasure to drive. I've had other Lexus in the past and they have always been great cars. The car is so easy to drive it feels like it is doing all of the work for me. I have recently had other cars and they become boring and aren't fun to drive. Thanks Lexus for making this car so amazing.
Just love it, what a perfect vehicle. The best I have driven.  Way better than the Benz or Bmer for thousand dollars less.

This is by far one of the most reliable, well built, and luxurious vehicles on the market.  The interior is silent, the engine is outstanding, brakes flawless, and the seats, stereo system, nav controls make for a very serene experience.  However, for a sports sedan, it is much too soft, and the steering is much too light.  In addition, the car can be harsh and twitchy with the optional 17 inch wheels.  Soft springs and low profile tires just don't mix well.  Stick with the 16 inch wheels and don't expect too much  from the chassis, and you will be very happy.  Overall a great car, but not a very emotion-evoking one.

I rely on these ratings fairly heavily so when i bought this car back in June I thought I should write to anyone considering buying one.  This is by far the best car I've ever owned. It has 63,000 miles on it and it drives like it is brand new.  It is so solid, so smooth, and has a ton of power.  I would recommend it to anyone considering buying one, you won't be disappointed.

Absolutely the best driving experience in a motor car and I have driven Bentleys, Rolls and Maybachs! Get in, buckle-up, if you would, and meld into the world of Levinson and Lexus. Look no further, chaps... There is no better on this earth! Here Here!!! Kudos to Lexus!~

Review_Title: Huge Power, Great Features, Smooth Ride
Review: This is a great car.  Tons of power, and all sorts o0f neat features tied in with the navigation system / ML Audio.  People are always amazed at how nice the interior is, very roomy and done in an extremely classy fashion.

I have tried used most, and tested the rest, vehicles in the top consumer class.  The Lexus (my first L) is the first luxury sedan I have acquired without a lingering feeling that I failed to get it all. This is the first time in my auto-buying career that I can sit up and breethe a complete breath of pure satisfaction.

PREVIOUS CAR 99 GS400. 2002 GS430 IS MUCH IMPROVED. STEERING, BRAKING, TORQUE, GPS AND MARK LEVINSON RADIO ALL IMPROVED. LOVED THE 99, BUT THE 430 IS BETTER. I DUMPED THE 17" TIRES THAT I HAD ON THE 99, BEST MOVE I'VE MADE, RODE LIKE A TRUCK AND SOUNDED LIKE SNOW TIRES. ALSO DUMPED THE BOY RACER SPOILER, WHICH LOOKS OUT OF PLACE FROM THE SIDE. GREAT RIDE, SPEED, LUXURY AND BEST OF ALL NO PROBLEMS. A FRIEND HAS A BMW 540I, HE COULD WRITE A BOOK ABOUT HIS PROBLEMS.
Exellent car.  The Best!

This is my second GS (the 1st was a '98 400). I never thought I would own two of the same type of vehicle, but I made any exception. Just when you thought the 400 didn';t need improvement, Lexus tweaked the tourque and the car SCREAMS!! Quicker, but I still me the gimmicky E-shift. You can keep the hard riding 540 and MB430..this is nicer to drive and more comfortable (and that's from people who have ridden in this car and own a 540 and MB430).

This is one of the BEST luxury sport rocket money can buy. I really love the design concept, the overall built quality and the best part of it-the VIP treatment I experienced in the dealership.The responsiveness of the engine, I can say-outstanding!I am very happy and satisfied with this car,the dealership/staff treatment and the compliments I get everywhere I go.I truly am happy and too young to own a LEXUS!!!

Review_Title: You gotta get one of these!
Review: No problems.  2 time Lexus owner.  We really like the car and service.  Mark Levinson stereo is fantastic!  Best and most fun car I have ever owned. Test drove the BMW M5, 540, 740.  M5 was great, too pricey.  540 too noisy and not quite enough power.  740, nice car but I could run faster.  Lexus hit the mark by balancing speed, safety,  and luxury at a reasonable price.

This is the quietest, smoothest, most comfortable, and most reliable sedans you can get. And it is one of the most powerful. It is so quiet & smooth, I can drive it all day without getting fatigued. And it does pretty well on the curvy roads, for a 4,000 lb. car. I get 29-30 MPG on the freeway at legal speeds, better than the car's rating.

Fantastic car.  Faster than a Boxster, 540, E430. More comfy than the BMW. Better control layout than the others. Better build quality in my experience too. JM LExus is THE dealership. BMW guy was snotty and insisted on going on the test drive. MERC dealer wanted my credit card before allowing a test drive (right!) Lexus chap said "take it out for the day" and I did!

Fantastic car.  Faster than a Boxster, 540, E430. More comfy than the BMW. Better control layout than the others. Better build quality in my experience too. JM LExus is THE dealership. BMW guy was snotty and insisted on going on the test drive. MERC dealer wanted my credit card before allowing a test drive (right!) Lexus chap said "take it out for the day" and I did!
Great Car.
The most incredible car of the century.
i love my wifes lexus.  it has been no trouble to us at all.  this is the car for anybody.

I purchased the GS 430 for less then a six cylinder Benz E class or a Bimmer 530i.  I regularly get 26 or 27 mpg on the highway with the cruise.  The power delivery and the trans are excellent.  The car is extremely comfortable, and the brakes are great.  The conbination of features at this price is unbeatable.
Good car. Fun to drive.  Fast.  Could use a little larger seat.  Bad tires from the factory.

As you probably know, lexus is a very nice make. The lexus lx is also the top of the line SUV. It was a great SUV for our family. At the time, we had a few other cars which were other lexus's including the LS. The LX was so nice to drive on the weekends, out to dinner, or when other people came to town!

I've had my LX 470 since late March, 2007 and have driven SUVs exclusively for the last 10 years.  While I've never paid close to what the LX 470 cost me, I must say it is worth it!  A great ride. Excellent sound system. Incredible on road trips, but runs through $70 of gas more quickly than I'd like.

Always wanted a luxury SUV. I test drove the RX 330 and the GX 470 but neither one has the comfort , the ride and the sheer power of this heavy SUV.  I love the looks inside and outside. Several times a year I am on the road up and down I-95 and traveling at about 85 to 90 miles using the air condition and we get 20 to 21 mpg on an almost 6000 pound SUV.

This is my 2nd LX 470 (1999) and my 5th Lexus model.  I test drove and researched every competing model before I purchased this vehicle.  Previous years owners will love the added horsepower.  The quality and workmanship is superior to everything else available.   I completely disagree with every complaint in the category - I don't think they understand the market.  The one drawback is size.   If you are looking for a larger SUV (Tahoe, Sub, etc.) the LX 470 will be too small for you.  Also, for towing, I just purchased an 07 Escalade ESV.   The LX470 is not large enough for towing but it's also way easier to park than larger SUVs.

Had the previous model - couldn't think of owning a different suv - from the stereo to the engine there is total reliability. I had a dvd system installed in the rear of the truck for my children and now its the best vehicle ever.

Open your wallets for this gas guzzler!  Too many electronics - takes some time to learn and get used to.  Love the navigation and stereo.  The sunroof is very loud when opened, but all in all it's a beautiful vehicle inside and out!

After only three weeks and almost 4000 miles, I've developed a love/hate relationship with the vehicle. Lexus has seen fit to "refine" the ride of the vehicle by using Dunlop tires instead of the Michelins we all loved.  This has created more body roll in turns than I find acceptable. Stiffer sidewalls were better. In an effort to keep us safe, Many functions are disabled while the car is in motion, such as Navigation System input.  Also, when locking or unlocking you are subjected to that insidious "beep" that not even the dealer can eliminate. I think that Lexus has forgotten it's off-road roots and has created a not so special vehicle-for-the-money. I'd rather have an older model.

I have had both a 2001 and a 2003 Landcruiser. I upgraded to the Lexus after a lot of research and thought.  Boy... I'm glad I did. The difference in price between the LC and Lexus is well worth it; the interior finish is better and the ride absolutely superb. With the new engine, there is also a marked improvement in power and smoothness when shifing and passing other vehicles.  I also LOVE the Bluetooth phone integration and pre-installed XM Radio.
Lexus continues to impress with outstanding quality and luxury performance. The Land Cruiser base is solid as ever and delivers rugged reliability topped off with Lexus comfort.
very luxerious, great vehicle,  VERY SAFE

After five years of owning a 2001 LX 470 I was told it was time for a new car. The problem was after test driving other SUV model cars there was no comparison.  The pick up was the biggest difference.  There is not another SUV of this size with the pick up and reliablity of pick up as the LX470.  There is not a smoother SUV on the road.  I bought the identical car and I would do it again.  The only complaints are the same as they were in 2001.  The third row seats are too difficult to operate and move in and out.  The tail gate should also swivel out as in the smaller 470 model.  I have to get into the car to remove groceries.  I'd also like another 6" split between the the back two seats.

Although the gas mileage is tough on the pocketbook... the performance and reliabilty are in a clas by itself.  The finest engineered SUV on the road or off road... when they come up with a  hybrid LX470... I will be the first in line.

nice vehicle over all. For the consumer that requires "high end" luxury i.e Real Estate Brokers like my self, I find that my clientele gives exceptional feedback to the vehicle. Amenities are prevalent throughout. Regarding dependability I personally have had zero issues.  Service the vehicle regularly and it should give 300k in mileage in the end. As a fast paced Realtor, dependability is key to my success. I'd highy recoment the LX 470 for those are accustomed to higher level of excellence.

It's slow--only 235HP--and prone to crosswinds on the highway. Plus the third seat is difficult to use and takes up lots of space, and my dealer in Boise is unimpressive. But the LX is very well built and has a comfortable interior...
Wonderful build quality, excellent interior, and pillow-like ride. Could use more power, though. And it wanders more than it should on the highway.
thank you for sharing that!
Bought 470 May '04.By end of May went

column1: on first road trip and discovered door
leaked and created an obnoxious
squealing sound while traveling at
high speed.Lexus dealership tried to
fix twice then gave up and sent us to
LEXUS USA.We have not gotten any
support from them at all.They haven't
addressed the problem. It's
unbelievable how badly they have
treated us. Our door still screams when
we travel which is every other
week. They have our 70K they win.Please
don't buy Lexus.

Review: By far the best SUV ever made, especially if you care about luxury.  Compared to my previous Range Rover (and even Landcruiser), the LX470 is simply amazing in its ability to deliver quiet, luxurious, reliable performance.  It is also beautiful and stylish, despite being around since 1998. Off-road capability (if you dare) is astounding and as good as any stock 4x4 out there.  On-road performance is sumptuous, smooth, quiet, relaxed.  Driving the LX470 just makes you feel like the world is a more peaceful place.  Security in snow and off-road is first-rate.
great all around car

I have only one negative comment - and that is the way the rear gate opens.  It opens like a door instad of like a gate.  When putting groceries in the back, I like to have the gate serve as a cover for me in the rain while I load groceries.  I'm not a fan of the way this back gate is designed.

Overall excellant vehicle.This vehicledoes everything well.Materials andcraftmanship are second to none.Ride is buttery smooth and very elegant.Marklevinson sound system rivals many homesystems.The navigation system is veryeasy to use and is very detailed. Thehandsfree Bluetooth Phone system isexcellant, every car should havethis.Overall this car is highlyrecommended and would purchase againnext time around.
Great vehicle. Wonderful to drive city

column1: and esp highway.

Review: My LX470  is a pleasure to drive. It very much feels as if I am gliding over the road as opposed to riding on it. The controls are thoughtfully positioned, the navigation system is efficient and the interior; luxurious. One shortfall, which is akin to my previous Landcruiser, is the lack of leg space provided by the third row seating.   However, this is not enough of a problem for me ot to purchase another 470 in a few years.

Very satisfying vehicle. Would recomment over Range Rover or G-class Benz. You don't get the quality, total elegance and quiet competence in all weather and terrain of the LX 470 in those vehicles. See for yourself.
Can't tell you how happy I have been

column1: with my LX. The dealer makes sure your
car buying experience and service is a
pleasure. On the few occasions I have
had to have something repaired they
have always been fast and eager to
please. Driving the LX is also a
pleasure. The quiet and smooth ride in
amazing for a SUV of this size.

Review: a 10...period....everything about this

column1: vehicle is awsome. Worth every penny.
buy it macked out with the Levison and
DVD

Review: Interior is awesome and unparalleled, comparing to those German $100K whatever. Exterior is grandiose. It kept 5 people comfortable in a 3000+ mile trip, mostly highway at 85mph and 14mpg. No electrical problem, no degrading in the ride quality so far. Bluetooth is convenient. DVD nav is handy, also the backup camera. Mark Levinson is better than some home audio. Ownership is superb. Overall, it does more than I can dream out of a $70K SUV. It gives me all the confidence I need for driving. For my family, it's an ultimate friend, way beyond a machine. I love her.
I love my Lexus 470! The car handles well, looks great, and has gotten me through some wicked snow storms and rain squalls. The interior is roomy and the sound system rocks.
Great SUV. Can't wait to buy my next

column1: one.

Review: I love my Lexus!  My son drives a 2003

column1: Range Rover and my family agrees that
the Lexus is much more comfortable to
ride.  It is just an amazing SUV!

Review: Amazing handling for a full time four

column1: wheel drive SUV.  Super interior
appointments.  Great looking exterior.
Navigation system is wonderful.

Review: This vehicle is wonderful! I had a Previa van and found the gas mileage to be about the same. Yes it takes higher premium gas as my husband always points out but I am worth the few cents difference!  It is so quiet inside you have to be careful of horns and ambulances..you may not hear them. Drawbacks-cd player is in a place that does not let you touch it unless stopped.(Safety minded!) It is sooo comfortable..! I have told my hubby if he never buys me another one, I'm keeping this one forever!

Review: My wife and I just returned home after a 2000 mile vacation trip in our new LX.  It doesn't handle, steer, or get gas mileage like a car, but we loved the smooth, quiet ride, and found the power to be more than adequate in most situations.  The nav system was very useful, but it sometimes created routes that made no sense; maybe it is malfunctioning, or maybe we don't fully understand it. Any nav that needs a half inch thick instruction book should be designed to be more user friendly.  But I'm hooked; I will have to have a nav system in any cars that I buy in the future.

Review: It's a great car to drive and ride in. SOOO comfortable, and powerful at the same time.
THE EXPERIENCE OF A LEXUS 470 2004 IS ABOUT LUXURY NOT POWER ,THERES NO BETTER RIDE THEN THE LEXUS 470
Over 100,000 miles and not one issue. Plan to keep this vehicle for 20 years. Most comfortable feel and ride available.
This is my third LX470, and it is fantastic.  The ride is incredibly smooth and quiet, and the radio is exceptional.  The NAV system is great.
Drove 2300 miles over Xmas. this SUV kept everyone comfortable even after 15+ hour driving. Smooth, quiet and solid.

I bought the 407 to drive from Florida to Wyoming and to drive the final 50 miles of poorly graded and sometimes impassable road. The last 10 miles was through mudslick downhills into mudholes of unknown depths and up 45 degree grades of eroded mud and rocks. We made it into one of the most remote ranches in Wyoming without any skids, slides or wheel spinning. The SUV was a muddy mess, but we were exhuberant. After driving back from Wyoming the 407 has led a much more sedate life as a semi-town car, but it's still fun to drive. Larry Sands. DeLand, Florida.

Great vechile. Drives beautifully. Will never buy any other brand SUV again. I will be a repeat customer for life and my family has tried them all We've owned jeeps, fords, gmcs, chevys, mercedes, bmws, vws, etc. Go lexus and never go back.

We liked our 1999 LX470 so much that we replaced it (100,000 miles) with a new 2004 LX470. The vehicle was wonderful and we never had a mechanical problem. We're confident that we will have the same experience with our 2004 version. Not as pretty as the Range Rover...but very dependable and great in the snow & ice.

THis is my 6th lx470. It is a wonderful vehicle to drive and the low hp240 is not a factor for every day driving. The comfort  and the quality of the vehicle is great. Using the current gear shift system and taking off the overdrive on climbing hills or passing, you would'nt know it has a low hp. This is a luxury car ride in an SUV. If you are towing something the it may feel a little underpowered. How often does the average 470 owner have something in tow? You won't get me buying anything but a 470. An upgrade in the cargo space and hp will be great in the new model, but for now this baby is the cream of the crop.

Review: Compared with any other SUV, this vehicle is definitely the best. The design is so impressive. It is fun to drive, easy to handle. It is classified as an SUV, but it feels way better than many smaller sedans. Acceleration is amazing. You barely can hear any noise inside this vehicle. I agree that this vehicle does not perfectly fit into the SUV category, but rather it is an LUV for "Luxury Utility Vehicle".

Review_Title: Best luxury SUV in the World
Review: This SUV is for riding in style. It is not for the family of 5 or more, but if you want to ride in style, this is the suv for you. All of the other suv's (navigator, escalade, range rover, etc) ride like a brick. This is pure luxury and if you can afford, don't miss out on it. This is the bentley of SUV's.

This is simply hands down the nicest large suv on the planet. I also looked at the Escalade and the difference in night and day. The interior of the Cadillac is made from the cheapest plastic imaginable. The quality in the LX is top-notch. If you want the best, and believe me I've tried them ALL, the LX470 is as good as it gets.

Review: Like the feel, comfort, low noise of theSUV.Build quality is excellent.Feels like driving a smooth sedan (ourother Mercedes); just at a higher groundlevel.Love the Mark Levinson Sound. Cargo space.

This automobile has been more than I ever imagined. It has met all of my expectations and beyond. To add to the top, every Lexus Service Department, I have ever encountered, has been top notch and had the most impeccable customer service all the way around. That is priceless. I will ONLY own a Lexus from now on.
This car is a pleasure to drive.  I recommend it to everyone that wants comfort and SUV abilities.

I'm from Monroe, NY a few months ago we had 31 inches of snow, no problem. It was amazing the way the car just cut into the snow, up stiff hills, of course you cannot fly through the snow, but you will not get stuck. I had Land Cruiser 99 for many years, I almost cried when I traded it in for this car in 2007, but I'm in love again. A friend of mine told me one day, "The only thing that will stop a Land Cruiser, is if the road is closed." The fuel economy concerns me, but my LX 470 is sitting in my garage, shiny and clean, we only drive it on the weekends. I have also IS 250, but I've been thinking of switching to a ES350, we need a bigger car.

I've been wanting to get a Lexus SUV for quite some time.  I waited until I was able to find the right price.  I also wanted to get the older body type instead of the new 570's, which look a bit odd to me.  I absolutely love this car!  It has great handling, smooth ride, and a beautiful interior.  It came fully loaded and you can't ask for anything more.  The only downside is of course the gas mileage.  But why would you buy an SUV without knowing that you would be paying a lot for gas.  Anyhow, we've taken it to various off road terrains and it handles nice.  I would highly recommend this car to any family!

The 470 is a very smooth riding enjoyable truck that offers enough HP for beaches to mountains. The gas mileage is worse than my former Chevy Suburban but the smooth quality ride is a little better.  Note to those considering: the navigation system is really bad. It blocks the driver and passenger from searching for anything while the vehicle is moving. There is no work-around and we were told there was a bypass by two dealerships we contacted when we couldn't figure out how I could use it while my husband drove. It is a huge flaw in the vehicle if you do more than local driving.  Lots of room in the interior and would love to keep but probably last Lexus due to nav limits.

This is a great car. I rated most of the comfort, performance, etc., a 9 and not a 10 because when rating car's comfort, a car is the gold standard compared to an SUV. For an SUV, it is pretty comfortable, esp. for one that can go off-road and isn't a "crossover." The only complaint I have heard is that the style is "dated." I would disagree, it's a nice looking car that's tough, yet refined and not crazy looking like some of the new SUVs around. It does eat up gas, but that's expected with a V8 in an SUV. Great car if you want to be able to go anywhere. Better value compared to any other lux SUVs in terms of options that come with it as a standard.
Reliable, safe, powerful
Smooth ride, luxury features. After 110K miles it has needed some repairs (ignition broke, suspension wiring went berserk).

Only the Range Rover comes close. The rest (Escalde, Navigator, Denali, X5, ML 430) pale in comparison in the things that really matter - RELIABILITY, resale and OVERALL statisfaction.A true luxury utility vehicle. Nice try Ford and Chevy, thank you for playing.

The Lexus LX470 is the finest SUV I've ever driven.  I live in the Colorado mountains and "use" this vehicle like a sports utility was meant to be used.  This vehicle is a fine example of a high end Lexus...  Very quiet and smooth.  It feels like you're floating on air!

I looked at 2004 Navigators and Escalades. I already own a 2003 Explorer. None of them compare to the refined ride of this vehicle. The off the line torque seems to be every bit as good as the Navigator and not that far from the Escalade. Most of the torque seems to be readily available at the lower end of the tach. The ride is incomparable. The handling is exceptional for a vehicle of this size/weight. The interior is as luxury as it gets with soft leather and burlwood accents. The navigation system is in a class of its own. Extremely intuitive to operate and accurate, with a huge screen. The third row seats are useful for small people only.
I bought this car being my first Lexus ever. I was amazed, this greatly compares to my new 2002 Mercedes SL600... I love the vehicle
How can such an expensive car not

column1: have a warning for back up like the
cheaper Fords and GM cars?

Review: if you love lexus you will love this car
Great machine but lacks some touches you would expect at this price...info computer, steering wheel controls, eye glass holder, readable clock and outside temp.

Bought my LX with 225,000 miles on it, felt like I got a great vehicle. It is beautiful, the perfect size, and EXTREMELY comfortable. BUT...this vehicle has a MAJOR problem that is not at all unusual. While on vacation with my fam, we were driving 40-50 mph on a curvy road, the VSC lights and chimes went crazy and the vehicle began braking hard left/right left/right, with loss of steering control. It was terrifying, but only lasted for a second or two. I began researching (clublexus.com is excellent) and discovered this is a common problem. There were hundreds of very similar reports...40-50 mph, going around sweeping curves. Just this morning it did the same thing six times in 15-20 minutes. Per the dealers recommendation I am returning the vehicle. It’s 90% awesome, but that other 10% could be catastrophic.

Review_Title: Good solid vehicle both on & off road
Review: Towable 4-wheels down - roomy but definately not a boulevard cruiser.  Body roll is a problem & the rear seats are not all that comfortable...it is basically a truck ride with a fair amount of road/wind noise at speed.

I'm a technician and I know build quality.You will not find this level of precision or quality with any other vehicle with full time 4 wheel drive and true transfer case.Bought used only because its virtually still new and we should all expect 350,000 miles of hard or pampered use from the LX470/Land cruisers.

Outstanding vehicle.  If you can afford it and want an SUV, look no further.  My LX 470 has 80,000 miles on it and it rides as nice as it did when I bought it.  Reliability, comfort and quality are super, not one rattle or vibration after the 6 years I have owned the vehicle. Probably built too well as there is no reason to get rid of it even after 6 years. I plan on keeping it for a long time and putting many more miles on it. Performs flawlessly in the snow as I can go anywhere.  Had to get to navigate on a steep, closed road one snowy day.  No problem at all in this vehicle.  Just a great vehicle.

I am on the road a lot and carry 400-500 lbs. in the back. I have just turned 200,000 miles and my only expense beside maintenance was a wheel bearing. I could never say this about any other car I have driven.
Ride is superior, never had a mechanical problem.  Quiet... this is my second 470lx and I probably will buy a third.

Very smooth and the 5 speed transmission is better than the old 4 speed I had in my 2000.  The interior upgrades are nice as is the adaptive steering.  The 2003 is also quieter than the previous models.  Gas mileage is not bad, but should be better.  Otherwise a great vehicle for driving in all conditions.

I have had many SUV's over the past 10 years, but never one that was "all-in-one."  This LUV (luxury utility vehicle) is the BEST of everything that I have ever wanted and enjoyed.  This LUV makes me "want" to drive, even on the busiest roadways.  The quality speaks volumes for the name Lexus.  This is The Vehicle that you can be comfortable taking ANYWHERE, the Country Club or camping or just kicking back for a cruise on the road.

I just picked up used 2003 LX470 and what can I say. It is the greatest SUV, I was looking to buy the GX470 but with the many complaints about the GX I was able to find used LX470 for the same price of a new GX.
Great SUV, fun to drive and I feel very safe on the highway. I love all the toys and the interior is so classy. I've owned other SUVs, but this time I've found a gem.

Review_Title: Luxury and Refinement Like Never Before
Review: This SUV, by far, is one of the best vehicles I have ever owned. It has everything you need to live large: Navigation, Night View, Adjustable Suspension, etc. The ride quality is by far the best I have ever experienced. It's way better than my MB S500. I also enjoy this SUV's creature comforts such as the adjustable suspension. You just push a button and the car automatically lowers about four inches from normal height. The most important part of this vehicle is that it is built by Lexus, a company that promises impeccable service at the dealership and a vehicle that will provide you with trouble-free maintenance for many years.
This is the second one I have had, and I feel very safe with my selection.  I will continue to buy the LX 470 in the future.

Great car, It can handle any obstacles as well as a great family vehicle.  Remarkable gas milage.

Wonderfully smooth and quiet ride, incredibly maneuverable and near-perfect road performance. My only problem with this gem is with the interior design, specifically with the seats. There are so many buttons and lights, but it's fun to figure them all out.

Without qualification, the best vehicle in its' class. Nothing else out there gives us what the LX 470 does. We will continue to be loyal customers until when and if someone designs and builds a better model, which I suspect will also be Lexus.

I have owned 2...bt far beats the competition hands down...no issues with performance...unmatched off road...and the quality is paramount to any vehicle I have ever owned.  They retain value and that is almost impossible with a car, but not with the LX470 or any Lexus for that matter.

I am driving my second LX470, I will never settle for another vehicle.  It is comfortable, safe, and ergonomically superior to any other car I've driven.  I told my husband the only way I'll give up this car is if he buys me a new LX470.  I've owned a Mercedes suv and that didn't compare.
Best SUV in the market
There is nothing even close and I own

column1: or have owned them all.

Review: 25K trouble free miles. 12-14 mpg expected when one notes the 5500+ lbs. of weight. Nothing on the market to compare with it unless the NEW Range Rover, now under German mgmt, might be a contender, but I would have to be shown.
Lexus continues to improve upon

column1: perfection.

Review: Overall, the LX 470 is good, but falls short of what it could be.  As has been noted, even w/ the 5hp increase and new tranny for '03, the LX is 35-50hp short of where it ought to be.  In addition, the general age of the platform has began to show.  It is not as space efficient as newer alternatives, and for a $70k vehicle, there are things that should be standard that aren't avail (no park distance control, no window sun shades, etc).  Sadly, when this vehicle is replaced w/ a Sequoia-based product, there will be a void in this size range (it's a big jump from a GX to a Sequoia!).  In all, can't say I'm disappointed, but I'm not gushing.

Of course the Lux stuff -- clients/investors ride in style in LA and DC. Always smooth and cool. Best part tho is the utility. Does everything in style. Camped in it for a month in the Sierra (slept in the back). Serious off-road in summer/winter in desert/mountain. Water crossings to 20". Climbs and scambles like a Wrangler but with a Lex ride. Amazing in snow with the adjustable suspension and stock tires. Delivers Docs and nurses in snow emergencies. Handles triple digit speeds in emergencies. Tows fine, not fast, but secure. 7,000K trailer with brakes no prob.
I love my Land Yacht

Review_Title: My glowing perception of our LX470
Review: This car is definitely a run for its money.  Though ours cost over $70,000, our family has grown to love it.  This is our second LX470 and we have no intention of living life without it.  It is powerful enough to drive up steep hills, yet luxurious enough for the driver to forget that they are driving an SUV.  The 8 plush leather seats accomodate the whole family and provide enough comfort to endure long journeys.  The Bose sound system plays loud and clear and helps us enjoy our drives even more.  I would definitely recommend this car to anyone who has a taste for luxury but needs to transport a truckload of people.  Definitely a 20 out of 10.
Excellent all around SUV

Review_Title: If money is not an issue, buy it!!!
Review: Nice SUV with excellent handling both on road and off road. Have to be careful on sharp turns at steep inclines off road. On road, you feel safe in the vehicle. Music system needs improvement. Excellent tires and show very little sign of wear and tear, despite 69000  miles on them.
Just the best Out there.  I will buy

Each morning I just can't wait to get in my vehicle and take off.   The only improvement possible would be to make it less expensive with better gas mileage (17 mpg, which is not bad for an SUV of any kind and better than most).

this is the best 4x4 ever.
love the truck, performs well always.  love the looks

just got my new LX470 a week ago, and already put in 350 miles( can't resist to spin it around the town).This car is built with the highest quality and so comfortable, smooth and luxury that you don't feel like driving a SUV. my perceived order of value).  After 2
months Im more convinced I made the
right decision.  The ability to lower
the vehicle has eliminated my
wife hopping in and out and has
proved to be quite useful in parking.
Not only is there practically non
existent road noise there is also the
absence of traffic fumes thanks to
the air quality sensor tied to
external/internal air flow control.   I
strongly recommend this vehicle to
anyone.

Review: This is a great SUV. Anyone thinking about getting it, should definitely test drive it. It rides so well you think that you are in a luxury sedan. It handles really well in the snow. It is a great vehicle for all occasions. It would look great going to a bussiness dinner or to a  secret cabin in the woods.

just got my new LX470 a week ago, and already put in 350 miles( can't resist to spin it around the town).This car is built with the highest quality and so comfortable, smooth and luxury that you don't feel like driving a SUV. I had owned and driven Acura MDX(2001&2002 models)recently, and there is no comparison!!!  You get what you pay for.

I first purchased an LX in 2000. I'm on my 3rd and 4th ones now. These don't ever break..ever. I have gray 2005 and my wife has a black 2007. Comfortable, reliable. They are fairly expensive new, but if you can find one(and it's difficult) a year old or so you will not be sorry. I live on an island in Florida and it floods often after heavy summer rains. no problem, Push the button to raise the car six inches and plow on through when you get to 20mph it lowers itself back down. In my opinion, this car looks like a perfect combination of tough and refined making it a true classic.

This is an astonishing vehicle. It provides 8 person seating, Leather, Fold up seats, and all. It has features to the max! We had the LX fully loaded to a SUV of $80,000. It had Navigation, DVD, Night Vision, Heated Seats (Front and Back) and just much, much More!
After Buying a GX a few months earlier, I traded in the piece of junk LR3 (which was 2 yrs newer).  Simply put a 5 yr old Lexus with 50k is better than any other brand new car.

I love the feeling when I wrap my hands around that wood trim steering wheel.The softy smooth whisper of the wind I here when I pull out in front of a car the humming of that 4.7V8 engine and the styling of the exterior.the smooth ride and the quick stopping brakes.this truck will blow your mind!!!!!!! this is the best luxury here!!!!!
This car is great to drive and a fun family car. You will get reliability, comfort and preformance.

Highway driving is not fun, all this truck needs is gasoline and you forget about rain or snow. It drives like a train on tracks. If getting there is your main concern, this will get you there. For city drivers, well this is not the easiest to park and not the cheapest to feed. In off road, well who the hell will drive a vehicle with this price tag off-road. It will amaze you to find that this is much more than you ever believed your vehicle could do.

Review_Title: It really is THE best SUV
Review: It is a little expensive. It could use a little more HP. Wish the fuel economy was better. But the ride, the quality and reliability, the safety features, all the electronics, are truly the best. You can't beat it in any of those categories. You have to test-drive this vehicle. Drive all the rest, and then drive the LX. It's truly something special.
Have been enjoying evrey single day. Ride is very smooth and stable especially at turns.

I have never been so happy with a vehicle purchase.  With all of the features that come with this SUV you wonder if there is anything you would need to add.  Lexus did not overlook anything when they built this truck. The suspension even lowers itself so that I can load items into the back of the truck. The only issue I do have is that the front of the vehicle is deceiving and takes some time to get used to.  And the tailgate or hatch in the back does not have an opening feature from the remote.

It has everything I wanted in a SUV and more.  The backup camera is a must on all SUVs and the navigation system cannot be beat.  The smooth ride and large open interior is not found in any other SUV.  The best is the lenght that allows it to be biggger on the inside by width and height and smaller on the outside so you can use this car in the city.  Not a problem to park.  The bluetooth phone system is also makes this SUV functional and safer.  The automatic wipers,lights and radio/cd/phone response make this a joy to own and truly makes driving easier.  The last and very important feature is the 3 different areas of air supply.  Even the 3rd row/cargo area has it's own vents.

My new LX470 is absolutely spectacular in ever way except fuel mileage.  This is my second LX470, the first being a 2002.  As delivered, from day one, there have been no problems what so ever.  Nice to drive, great fit and finish, and impressive off road performance.   What else can I say, it is a Lexus. Dave

This is a great suv. It really shines in the snow, when everyone else is slipping and sliding I'm glued to the road with unmatched luxury. Plus it seems the gas mileage gets better over time. Also it's super quiet and refined. The only problem for those of you who like to get up and go is the horsepower, but thats all right.To sum it up: the best there is, the best there was and the best there ever will be.

Review_Title: The Best SUV in the Market..3rd Purchase
Review: Simply the best SUV Truck money can buy.   I first purchased this truck in 1999 in white, again in 2003 in Galactic Gray, and now again in White Blizzard.  Each time I reviewed all competitive models including Cadillac, Land Rover, Hummer, etc. and kept coming with the same conclusion:  "This is simply the best designed, most comfortable, roomy, and best handling SUV in the market today!"  I even got to Crash test the 2003 with a Snow Plow and while I did not win, the vehicle handled the impact better than any vehicle ever owned.  I was safe and once repaired, it drove as well as before.  The LX 470 is quiet, permitting total enjoyment over long highway rides, with the entire family in tow.

Review_Title: excellent, the best car on the road
Review: SMOOTH, RELIABLE,ADEQUATE POWER, A BEAUTIFUL VEHICLE.I HATE TO SEE SOME PEOPLE COMPARING THIS VEHICLE WITH THOSE UNRELIABLE AMERICAN CARS LIKE YUKON,OR A IMITATION CAR LIKE KIA, PLEASE BE HONEST AND TELL CONSUMERS THE REAL FACTS, LEXUS IS BY FAR THE BEST CAR ON THE ROAD...PERIOD...
The most comfortable SUV I have ever

column1: driven. Quality is beyond reproach. Buy
one if you can afford it!

Review: This is my 8th SUV over $50,000 and my 1st Lexus.  It is so much nicer than any of other vehicle I have driven in this class.  I actually look forward to being in this vehicle.
best suv in world. service is a lot

column1: better than toyota

Review: I write with 3000 miles and 3 months of use-experience, both in town and highway.  It handles well, parks easily, has all the power I could want, and is easy to get in and out of, comfortable, and quiet.  I've had zero problems.  It's a bit boxy in exterior style.  My other car is a 2004 Prius, at the other extreme of fuel efficiency, so I average about 30 mpg between the two -- (15 + 45)/2.  A hybrid LX won't repeal the laws of physics, but recapturing some of the LX's kinetic energy could improve the numbers somewhat.
This is the best riding most

column1: comfortable SUV i have ever owned. I
will never buy any other type of SUV
than this one ..It beats all the
competition in every category except
mileage.. I have owned the rest and
this is the best one!!!!!!!!!!

Review: The Lexus LX470 is worth every penny. Like the Landcrusier in looks ,but not ride. We have a Landcruiser as well and I have to say the Lexus rides so much smoother. There is also a difference in service when I take my car in for maintenance. Toyota has nothing on Lexus for their service department.This is a suv worth every penny..
I would rate this is as one of the best 4 wheels ever produced, luxury power and style. Lest say it is Beauty and the Beast togather.

My 2000 LX470 just turned 325K miles.  It doesn't use a teaspoon of oil between 7K mile oil changes.  Just put a new aftermarket exhaust system on it.  I have used regular gas since day 1.  Depending on highway or city driving, I have consistently gotten anywhere from 14-17 mpg.  That has not changed in 18 years.  The best car I've ever owned.  It owes me nothing.  I love it as much as the day I got it.  Never thought I'd own a car/truck for 18 years.  The paint is still beautiful.  I am emotionally attached to this truck.
The only thing about this car i dont like about this car is the MPG i get around 10, however that is after 16 years and 336000 miles.
Dependability Well maintained

Had this SUV for a long time now, and the quality of the vehicle is terrible. Too many issues and too many costly repairs. I have under 100k miles on this.Issues:1 CD.. Disks get stuck in the player 2 Ignition went out, and it cost me $1200 (non-dealership) to fix it. I was told that Lexus placed the starter in such a position that it takes a min of 4 hrs to replace. A similar replacement on American cars take less than 1hr.3. The Antenna doesn't go down. Didn't fix this.4. Shock are leaking oil and needed replacement. $25005. Recently the ignition switch actually broken when turning the key. What a crappy engineering using cheap metals. $1200. The dealer says it is normal.

Have owned my 2000 LX470 (90,000 miles) for almost a month. It has been the best car I have ever owned by a long shot. The ride and handling are top notch. Not quite as fast as my Denali, but very smooth. It will climb over just about anything too, but you hate to take it off road because it's too good looking to take a chance on scratching it. My only complaints so far is the tiny plastic cover that covers the little window that displays the time and temperature is coming off. Also my moon roof may have a short in it as it takes several tries to get it closed. It also has more buttons in it than any other vehicle I have ever owned. Be prepared to read the owners manual.

After owning a Tahoe, Expedition and Denali I finally bought a 2000 Lexus LX470 with 90,000 miles. It was the only one I could find in my price range. I have only had it a month but it is easily the nicest vehicle I have ever owned. It has more buttons than a NASA spacecraft, but I think I finally have most of them figured out. It is not as quick as my Denali was, but as far as build quality, ride, comfort, and looks, it's hard to beat. I'm hoping that it can go another 90,000 if I take care of it.

Purchased new in April of 2000 .I drive this Lexus very little, has been garaged all its life. Now has 79,900 miles. At 66,780 suspension went out,,cost to repair $2600 + in 2005. Now after 13123 miles suspension went out again (Feb 2010).Service department says this is going to happen about every five (5) years no matter how few miles it has been driven (13123). Cost to repair now $3350+. It looks brand new inside and out but now rides like a gravel truck, this will be my last Lexus

I got this vehicle used with 180,000 miles on it.  I always liked this vehicle but could never afford a new one.  I took it to the dealership and they just take the best care of you and they gave the car an extensive overview which the noted the things I should fix since then, I have been riding high.   I love it so much.  It has the ride of a luxury car and it does have more performance in the power mode.  Mine had many upgrades including chrome rims, dvd players in the head rest and many other toys.  It's paid for and I'm going to ride it until the wheels fall off.  It still turns heads and people are always asking me how much I'd sell it for and I respond I would never do it!!

Review_Title: Best Rig on the Road for the NW
Review: I've had my Lexus for 4 years.  Its my favorite vehicle I have ever owned out nine.  I feel safe, secluded, pampered, yet enjoy the capability in the snow and off road of the NW.  I put 295/75/16 BFG All Terrains on it, and it looks sweet.  I will probably never sell it, as it has everything I need and like.  A heated seats, a center locking diff, suspension adjustment, sunroof, killer stereo, etc.  The size is perfect too, such that you can park it with ease unlike a Suburban, Escalade, or Sequoia.  And it fits in the garage with room to walk around it. The new one looks great, but until they make it with 25 -30 mpg there is no reason to upgrade. Buy a 99-02 model and you'll be happy.

Review_Title: SUV that feels like a luxury car
Review: The interior of this vehicle is beautiful.  When you get in it, you are bathed in luxury.  The engine is very quiet and the ride is nice.  You are amazed how fast you are going when you look down at the gauges while on the highway.  I would recommend this vehicle to anyone who is looking for the ultimate luxury SUV.  Lexus is second to none.

Review_Title: It's Good To Be The King
Review: After looking over many of the luxury SUVs available. The LX is hands down the best "real" SUV you can buy.  This 2000 vehicle has almost all the features my new 2006 sedan has (heated seats, auto dimming rear views) and some it doesn't (electronic stability control to prevent rollovers, ride height adjustment and real time dynamic suspension, and two independent climate controls for front and rear passengers). And even though a bit sluggish from a stop, it has lots of pulling power (80% of which is available at just 1100 rpm!), the sign of a "true" SUV with an engine designed for it, not just out of a truck. You will get use to the gas mileage.

Driving across the country at least once a year with our two yellow labs, we have found the LX 470 to be a very comfortable, safe, and all-around great vehicle!  Driving up Hwy 1 in CA was a blast, and I never have a problem getting around in some of the incredible snows we have here in Colorado - I've pulled out numerous vehicles out of being stuck in ditches, etc., and even pulled an Nissan Xterra up a hill by my house from a standstill 1/3rd of the way up where a lot of people just park their cars at the bottom and hike their way up - ALL included in this display were VERY impressed - I've even noticed a few of my neighbors (3 now) have gotten one since!

I bought this car new in 2000 and she now has 120,000 miles on her.  I often comment to my friends how well the car still drives.  I really mean it.  After all those miles, the ride is still extraordinarily smooth.  The car has held up quite well and all I have had to replace is the front brake rotors.  If you are looking for comfort in a big SUV, this is the one to buy!  You can get them for good prices used and since they hold up so well, don't be afraid of buying them used with maybe 50+k miles.  Also, the thing is an absolute TANK when it comes to snow.  I have literally taken mine through 2 feet of snow without hesitation.  It's the best car in the snow that I have ever owned.

Test drove just about every large suv's on the market and the Lexus was heads and shoulders above the rest.  We were looking for a quality used vehicle that would be reliable. After owning the LX 470 for over a year and a half we are still singing its praises.
It is a joy to drive everyday even

column1: after 3+ years.

Review: I bought this LX470 for $30 grand, at the time the mileage was 77k. i thought this was kind of high but when it comes to a Lexus, mileage doesn't matter cause the car can run forever. anyways, the LX470 i bought came with chrome wheels, chrome bumper guard and the tail lights guard, with a gold package. It is awesome, the paint is unbeatable and it is even better than my 98 ES 300. I used to think of SUVs are bumpy but when it comes to the LX470, it is quiet, smooth, it feels as if you are floating on a boat when travel at high speed on highways as well as bumpy roads. i love this suv!

Bought this vehicle one year ago with 72000 miles on it. Now has 81000 miles. Wonderful trip ride. Great capacity to carry stuff. All around great vehicles. Drove through 12 inches of snow with it last winter. Goes anywhere. Dealers have great service. Only issue with it is CD changer died. $600 to replace. Oh well, even Lexus isn't perfect!

A very comfortable vehicle - I bought this new for my wife and it has been a good vehicle for us on trips and daily driving and I love the off-road ability.  I have been dissapointed with the reliability of the vehicle and the dealer experience has been poor!   I doubt we will buy another one.  Originally, I wanted a Mercedes but they didn't (still don't) have anyting large enough for our needs. Overall, Lexus tends to be a little guady with styling and getting worse.

We just purchased this beauty (gold) from a dealer in Houston, TX.  After driving the LX470, the Escalade (what a joke for $58,000), the Navigator, & the Sequoia we decided to drive to Houston (best prices/live in Louisiana)to purchase the certified LX470 (only 36,000 miles).  This SUV is everything we hoped it would be. We traded in our '98 Jeep Grand Cherokee which we drove to Houston and that made the experience driving home a dream.    None of the other vehicles could match the LX470 smooth ride and comfortable seating.  I can't believe we waited so long to purchase one.

Review_Title: this is not a suv it's a luxury car
Review: i'v owned a range rover 4.6 i thought

column1: this was it i was so mistaken the lexus
lx 470 dives and handles like the best
of the best comfort everything i was so
surprized go ahead lexus

Review: Couldn't have picked a better vehicle!

column1: Just love my LX470!

Review: What a wonderful SUV to drive.  Safe, comfortable, reliable.  I was an owner of 3 luxury SUV's & the LX470 beats them all.
This suv is king... it is the best of

column1: the best in all areas.  It is in a
class of its own.

Review: I have owned 30 vehicles in my life.

column1: Two of the Best have been a LEXUS. My
LX470 rides on air and stops on a dime.

Review: We test drove just about all available large size SUV's and never found one that can compete with the ride, looks, and quality.

I owned a Land Rover, Range Rover for four years prior to buying the Lexus.  Had all the bells and whistles.  My 470LX is so much more of a car.  Accelleration is much better, gas a little better, Let's face it, hardly anyone takes either car "off road". Absolutely no comparisons when it comes to comfort, luxury and ride. Ride comparison: 9 vs. 4+ (RR) Going on 40,000 miles on original set of tires, RR was luckly to get 20-25,000.

This vehicle has been a joy to own.  The couple of minor cosmetic defects were addressed immediately by the service department and covered under warranty.  The  acceleration is outstanding and the ride is wonderful.
I feel its sporty when needed, u could turn it into even more luxurious or even more sporty by adjusting a switch controling the shocks.  Beutiful must have.
Just the best large SUV out there.  I've not found a better ride in any comparable size.  I love the quiet cabin & stable feel.  Ergonomics are great!

Review_Title: More than I needed - but dependable
Review: Bought the car 4 years ago because we thought we would be going into the woods and hauling.  Well we never did either, although we live in Chicago so it's nice in the snow.  Everything about the car is great, the ride, interior, dependability, lost cost of ownership, except for gas.  So my biggest complaint is MPG.  I get 13-15 in suburban driving and 15-16 on the highway.  For this size car there other options that get 20+ MPG such as the Honda passport. No serious mechanical issues, in fact no minor mechanical issues except a leaky CV boot, which is good since I bought it used.  Height/level adjustment is nice but unnecessary unless you are towing. I recommend for people towing/traveling.

This truck is comfortable, smart, and capable.  No other car in the world has this quality.  No other car in the world has this capability combined with such luxury.  I feel on top of the world behind the wheel, and can only think of getting another one for my wife.
This SUV rides unbelievable,it is the most comfortable automobile I have been in.
By far, this is the ultimate SUV.  Nothing else compares with the quality and features.
We love this vehicle, in fact it is our second one!

Review_Title: This review for 2001 -- Still has bugs
Review: I had a 1998 LX470 with several

column1: problems. It always pulled to one side
or the other (steering wheel never
centered correctly) on highway;
emergency brake cable rattled near/at
right rear wheel; tilt/telescope motors
went out several times. Lexus never
could fix either problem; took back
under lemon law. I bought a 2001 just
like it hoping they would have fixed
problems. New 2001 pulls to left at
highway speeds; same emergency brake
cable rattle at right rear wheel;
tilt/telescope motors already replaced
once; transfer case replaced
(vibration); Several rattles interior.
Very disappointing to have basically
same problems on same vehicle 3 model
years later.

Review: with the 2002 lexus lx 470's navigation system being lost will be a thing of the past!  I love my lx.  so far, i have taken it on 15 road trips and it is still running great!  service is great. they come to your house and service it for you in less than an hour.  interior designn is superior to all other luxury vechiles.  I love my lexus LX 470!

Review_Title: It doesn't get better than this
Review: This vehicle is the ultimate SUV on the planet.  It has all the bells and whistles, has Lexus reliability and build quality, and styling that is unmatched by any of its competitors.  It's one of those few vehicles on the road that tells the world, "you've arrived."
Its far to large. No reason for it to be made. Horrible fuel mielage. Not great looking. High price for not such a great vehicle. Horrible engine.... Much to slow, no power at all.
Bar none, the best SUV on the market right now.

This is my 2nd LX-470.  My 98 was awesome, but the 2002 is even better.  It's like sitting in your living room on trips.  It can be driven in "fun" mode or "luxury" mode depending on how one feels.  It was definitely worth the four year upgrade to get the Nav System and the Mark Levinson Audio System, plus a few other new bells and whistles.  I can't imagine another vehicle I'd rather own.

There is nothing better than to take my LX470 out on those long road trips with my family. It is comfortable, large, and isn't as homely as a minivan. It feels muscular and powerful. My only complaint is that it should get more power.
this car is worth buying

This is the best car i have ever owned With the navigation system and the mark levision sets this baby apart. The sound is the best and when you can rais andlower the car and ajust the suspension it roks. I suggest you try the car or test drive it.
Nice, macho appearence. Quite and elegant ride. good electronics and interior
Best SUV out there if $$ are no object

Climate control and audio system are excellent. Driver seat feels hard andtends to push driver forward awkwardly.Stubborn starting problems. The starter feels too weak for the engine, and it is normal to have to try 2 or 3 times to get a start that keeps running. It is in the garage now and won't start, so when I have time I am planning to have it towed to the dealer in hopes that a new battery will solve the problem.

Solid SUV, strong, already tested in off road situation, mud and climbing also. Very smooth driving, good looking truck (turning head) specially in green color. Solf seats, this is not a gas saver vehicle but it is fun to drive, elegant machine, big engine. I recommend this SUV with no doubt! This is not the first lexus that I purchase., and this will not be the last one either!!

Had my 99 LX 470 from 20,000miles and I just hit 275,000. Ignition coils and rusty exhaust pipe because I live in Minnesota have been the only non scheduled maintenance things I have ever done to her. Always reliable, never get stuck in the snow. She is my fancy tank. Love it, would recommend to anyone not concerned with burning premium fuel like its going out of style.

Purchased as 2nd owner with 50,000 miles, havehad it since 2003 now has 110,000 miles on itthe moulding on doors was replaced twice because of wind noise still noisy.Radio bad-cd quite working about 1 year ago went to cassette and now it dosen't work and the antenna failed all with less than 110,000 easy miles on it.Our upkeep is around 3500 every 9-12 months the leather interior is cracking and is going to cost about 800 to replace.Worst car (for the money spent) that I have ever had.We have a 1992 honda accord with 300,000 miles that I drive.

We bought this car over 11 years ago and it is still our most reliable vehicle. no one can believe it is as old as it is! no rattles-has never broken down! ever!  drives like our 2007 Lexus sedan. we will NEVER get rid of this vehicle!

Bought this vehicle used from repeat owner of LX 470s who also loves the LX 470. We have driven it in the Rocky Mountains and Northern Michigan in various extreme weather and road conditions and it hardly skipped a heartbeat. Then the problems. Front wheel portion of AWD failed completely without warning and complete and thorough maintenance & records upkeep. No reason, just failed with less than 120K miles on vehicle. Lexus Company left me dry and lacking enthusiasm for its continued reliability stating I should have bought extended warranty. Chagrined that a seemingly top notch vehicle of this caliber has such a major problem with so few miles, but goes to show failure happens

We've owned it since new. On long trips, it feels like you're sitting in a comfy chair in your living room. On the negative side, too many unnecessary options for headlights, give us "on" or "off". The height adjustment was also a useless addition, we never used it. Also, the button to engage the 4-wheel drive was placed where it could be inadvertently hit which happened several times for us and caused problems. Would like to see Lexus add some practical options, like an automatic step that would engage and allow older or physically challenged passengers easier access. Overall, though, it's been a delightful vehicle.

We love our LX 470, I especially liked the way it did in the mountains. It is easily the smoothest riding vehicle in its class that I have ever driven. People are always asking if it is a new vehicle. I tell them it has high miles and a 1999 and they find it hard to believe.

Review_Title: I enjoy driving this car every day
Review: I love the comfort and realibity of this car. I wanted an SUV with a look, performance, comfort, realibility and I found the LX. I just make sure I change the oil every 3 months, and do the maintenance at recommended mileage. I wish Lexus offered 22 inch rims for the car; it is very hard to find a rim that will fit the car. It has an unusual ball pattern. Great car, what else can anyone ask for?

In my 50 years of owning and driving vehicles, this one is my favorite. It's also been the most reliable and trouble free and the dealership has been a pleasure with the routine upkeep of the vehicle. This is truly a "turn-key" situation, just turn it on and go, in comfort and style. This is also the first vehicle I've ever owned for 200,000 miles. And they've been virtually trouble free.

I picked up this vehicle with a lot of miles but it still rides better than most brand new cars.  The quality build by Toyota/Lexus is simply amazing.  I have had many cars but this one is superior in so many categories most specifically in the quality product.  Everyone loves this vehicle when they get in it and no one can believe it has 132K miles for the way it looks or feels.  The leather doesn't show any cracks and there are no annoying rattles.  You will not regret buying this vehicle (just be ready to pay at the pump).  You will LOVE this car.
One of the most reliable vehicles I've ever owned. The fact that the body style hasn't changed in a while it makes it almost impossible to tell the model year.

I have owned 12 SUVs and this vehicle is hands down the best. It handles like a much smaller 4x4 but with unmatched amenities. I have become a repeat buyer of the Lexus 4x4. The quality of the vehicle coupled with the management style of Lexus and its dealership simply blows away all of it competition.  Although I like the lines of the LR slightly better the ride and reliablity of the LX 470 will keep me coming back time and again.  BFB

Upgraded from a minivan and love the vehicle.  Lexus is it as far as build quality and ride.  A few minor problems but overall a really fabulous vehicle.  Mine has nearly 80,000 miles and rides better than any other new SUV you can name.

Recently purchased this vehicle used and I absolutely Love the car.  The style and condition was excellent.  Extremely smooth ride-expecially with the height control.  If you Love gadgets, this vehicle has it.  Of course the fuel economy is going to be bad-it's a V8 engine and a lot of car.  Every LX 470 owner knows this prior to purchasing this car.
Fantastic build quality. For a used vehicle, no one can believe this vehicle has 79,000 miles on it! Whisper quiet, silky smooth.

My girls named her "Linda" because she deserves a nice name.  Minivans are not "us" and we are always on the go between work, swim team and soccer.  We love the comfort, the ride and the looks.  She's the perfect solution for us.

I am the lucky owner of a Cashmere colored 99 LX 470. This vehicle has it all, great looks, reliability, and the best retention of value. Mine also sports a WAAG front and rear brush guard, with 6 inch Piaa's on the front. It gives it a nice mix of rugged, yet very elegant. This vehicle is a must for any one that wants the best of both worlds.
Go anywhere in any weather in style and comfort.  Gas: 14-16 mpg is the only shortcoming, but that is to be expected when getting hauled around by this full-time AWD powerful V-8.
We are very happy with this vehicle.
Wanted a Land Cruiser with a bit extra

column1: comfort and Lexus level dealer service.
Got it all and more with this vehicle -
it continues to surprise me with its
awesome construction quality and
smoothness of operation.  You just
drive it and it works - simple as
that.  Spent a reasonable amount of
time off road as well and it has been
faultless (mountain passes/driveable
beaches/deep snow).

Review: Purchased new with the redesign in 1998. And I can say it has been the best large SUV I have ever owned. To this day though it is a 98 model, I have kept it looking new and I cannot convince people the truck is 12 years old. Most people tend to think it is a 2005-06 year model. Lexus did a good job with a look that has stood the test of time. Has never left me stranded and the only time it has been to the dealership has been for routine maintenancealbeit very expensive maintenance. The 90k mile service was the most expensive.
