Test drove Mercedes SUV, Volvo C90, Landcruiser, and Land Rover LR3....None compared in terms of  luxury, ride, & handling relative to price. Previous car was  Lincoln Navigator. While GX470 is in fact on a smaller frame, I feel I've lost nothing in storage space, passenger room and only gained in a smaller more managable ultra luxurious SUV!!

So far, I like the truck. I drive itaround the corner just like the way Idrive my car (40+ miles) so KDSS must beworking hard at the corners to maintainthe balance of this heavy truck. Boththe DVD and Navigation can pay DVDmovies to entertain all passageser whentruck is not moving. The 5:1 soundchannels worked wonderfully, the soundquality of wireless headphones arecrystal clear. I think it works evenbetter than my home theater soundsystem. It even offers a cassette playerwhich I can use to play those tapes Ihave stored in my closet for nearly 20years!! For mechanical and electricalcomponents quality only time will tellbut I would trust Lexus to offersuperior build quality
i love this suv

The good use of interior space makes this car as big as my old Expedition was.  It handles very nicely.  None of the rattles and truck like ride I had with other SUV's is present in this car.  It is missing power rear windows, and sometimes on left turns there is a bit of a blind spot.  Overall, I'd have to say I love the car - and I get 16 miles per gallon, which is not too bad for an SUV.

This suv is great!  I have had numberous suv's.  This only drives very nicely, has a great interior and is VERY quite. The automobile does NOT drive like a truck.  Fuel is not bad, I fill my tank once a week.  I drive a lot with two kids.  There was difference in gas milage from my old mini van. The Lexus GX 470 is WONDERFUL!

you get what you pay for in this car. i just got this car on the 17th and i have never made a better decision. the voice command on the navigation is so much easier to use than other cars along with the navigation screen. the space to see behind you in reverse is limited but that isnt a problem if you got the rearview camera. the standard all wheel drive works like a charm and you couldnt ask for more standard features in any other cars. it even comes with the hill climbing systems and the height leveling system. the back door is very unique. i dont find the 3rd row seat very bad at all, after all, it has air conditioning. best car i ever had with bmw 5 series

The minute you get into the car you're floating on clouds. The ride is unbelievable. I previously owned a Toyota Sequoia which was also a great vehicle but I felt I didn't need to drive around in a car that big.It's the perfect size, gliding ride, and luxury style

I bought my 04 GX470 after looking at all of the choices in the class. The Lexus just offered more of what I wanted..an exceptional luxury interior, smooth refined powertrain, and the best reputation for quality and dealer service in the industry. I've had it on rough city streets and out on the freeway, and the ride and road manners are impeccable in all situations. It doesn't handle like a sports car , but I didn't buy a sports car either. It's handling is easy and supremely comfortable. Lots of room in the back seat for adults, the third seat is pretty useless though unless you haul munchkins around. Adjustable suspension settings work well, letting you set the handling/ride as you like.

This is a fantastic vehicle, but it baffles my mind how did the designers failed to deal with the wind shudder. The wind shudder when opening the back windows of this vehicle render them almost unusable.  A gross omission in an otherwise terrific vehicle.
The GX 470 is a pleasure to drive.  The

column1: only draw back is the CD player which
is in the glove box.  It is just a
cream to drive.

Review: I love my GX470.  I think it is the

column1: best car I have ever owned.  The layout
is excellent and my kids love the DVD
system.  Great turning radius.

Review: rear door swings open into traffic.

column1: Window does not open/close.  No way to
leave door open for an extra long load.
must have at least 4' behind vehicle to
open door.

Review: I bought my GX during the Lexus Golden opportunity Day.  I was told that there were no incentives on the GX.  But I found out later that that was not true.Lexus has decided to drop the prices on the GX by making the worthless 3rd seat a N/C item on the last of the 2004 models.  So, I lost $2000 by buying during the Lexus golden opportunity days.Beware these guys are tricky and they Lie. Go buy a Sequioa or Infiniti.
Perfect!  Even the fuel efficiency is

column1: not as bad as some other people
claimed. I got over 20 mpg on my
everyday commute (half local and half
highway).

Review: All I can say is that we loved the GX SO much that we bought 2! We traded in an LS & an RX & we think we got the best of both vehicles in the GX. I have 2 carseats in my GX @ all times as well as a dble jog stroller & I'm still able to fit in more plants & groceries than you can imagine! The DVD player is a godsend; it keeps my girls happy & the headphones are great!My husband is a salesrep & puts about 40K + miles a yr on his vehicles & the GX has so many great features especially the GPS system that help him to make the GX his rolling office. Oh, and the GX can really MOVE! To sum it up; the GX is is an all round AWESOME vehical for anyone & everyone!
Excellent vehicle, everything as promised and more. 0 complaints, dealership made purchasing quite painless and I'm very picky.
I have had alot of technical problems. Also, the first year out, it has mechanical problems (drivetrain).

At 75 miles per hour or less, this vehicle give good mileage for the size and engine. The bulbs under the headlights doesn't last long.  I have to replace the bulb every six months. As for the comfort of this vehicle, it is really a dream come true.  I recommend this vehicle especially for long distance driving.

After looking and eliminating the VW-Touareg and the BMW-X5 found no comparison against the GX-470. Riding, hadling, interior and exterior quality and craftsmanship and value for $$. Probably the best vehicle I've ever owned and not to mention the VIP treatment at the Northside Lexus Houston, Tx. dealership.

With this vehicle, you look for places to drive.  It's comfortable, smooth, quiet, surefooted and handles better than most cars.  Every feature and button is laid out where it should be.  Navigation system is by far the best in the industry.  Touch screen also carries the radio, climate control & DVD.  MB's is frustrating to use.  Vehicle is unstoppable.  I've had journeys through 40" snow storms with ease and have traversed uphill dirt piles for fun.  Of every 4wd vehicle I've had, this is the most capable.
The GX 470 is a dream of a car.  Solid handling, plush interior, sharp lines and great ride for such a short wheelbase.  Very quiet and roomy.
I was very disappointed in the comfort

column1: and noise reduction that Lexus stands
for. i took it for a test drive. I
driven both a Kenetic and non
KDSS vehicle.  There were no
difference just a $4k price increase.
The salesman says only notice if it's
on an offroad terrain. Don't get me
wrong it's a great vehicle but for the
price you are paying you expect a
little bit more quality. I own a '97
4x4 limited 4runner (havent had any
trouble yet). I hardly know the
difference in ride. You can still feel
the bumps on the road and hear the
wind noise on the windows. I guess
Lexus did a great job covering that up
with the nav and entertainment system!

Review: GREATEST USED VEHICLE THAT I'VE EVER OWNED. BESIDES CHANGING OIL & REFRESHING FLUIDS, REPLACE BATTERY IS ALL I'VE DONE  IN 7 YEARS!

A Lexus mechanic checked out my car prior to purchase. Beware there are some trouble spots, but overall they are one of the most reliable vehicles you can buy. If you are a Lexus owner, you have access to all Lexus service records online (including records prior to your ownership). This is a great resource. We traded a RX330 for the GX, the GX has a much nicer interior and the build quality is amazing. Very pleased with the vehicle.

After we had our second child, we were looking to replace our '04 Jeep Grand Cherokee with something a bit larger, and higher end. With two kids, two large dogs, and the needed ability to tow and secure a motorcycle carrier to the tow hitch, the choices were limited. I researched several SUVs in this class, but all reviews and stats kept leading me back to the GX. I started looking for certified pre-owned GXs with low mileage, and there weren't many. I took that as a sign that these vehicles were sought after and kept. I finally found an immaculate '07 with only 25K miles on it. After we drove it, we realized why everyone gushes over their Lexus cars and suvs. It drives much smaller than it is, and it's really comfortable and very quiet. The power is awesome, especially off the line and charging uphill. It tows easily and has a tongue weight of 650+ lbs to handle my moto carrying needs. Interior storage space is more than ample. The 3rd row is handy when you need it, and easy to remove when you don't. Other than the 16mpg avg, I really have no complaints. We have taken our GX in the snow, mud, on icy roads, and everywhere in between, and it handles it all without flinching. I am thoroughly impressed, and would definitely recommend it.PROS: Powerful motor, smooth, quiet ride, car-like handling, comfortable seats, reliable, and go anywhere AWDCONS: Avg 16MPG, and the navigation is crap. (But, who uses the car nav with smartphones anyway?)

Luxury and power.  Built on a solid truck frame yet the ride control feature allows an adjustable ride. Able to tow 6500pounds. Currently tow a 3000 pound boat, mpg 13. Comfortable is all respects plus give the feeling of safety.  Well thought design but should have a larger gas tank.  Easily earns its consumer report outstanding "recommended buy" rating.

Review_Title: Solid, powerful and reliable. Great luxury SUV
Review: We owned a 2004 Jeep Grand Cherokee for 6 years before this, which was a solid and powerful SUV, but this GX is several rungs up the quality ladder. Ample, smooth power, VERY comfortable and quiet even at freeway speeds. Rock solid in the snow and rain and very reliable. 3rd row seats are handy, and easy to fold up or remove. Anyone who says it's difficult is mechanically inept. Literally takes < 1 min.Side swinging rear door is great in some situations, not so great in others. I personally like it, and the locking hinge open, feature is helpful.Not the best mileage at 14-15 mi. combined avg per gallon (much better on freeway), but it is a fairly large, heavy, luxury SUV with a V8, so actually not too bad. Handles great for its size, and the driving modes and right height adjustments really help for specific driving and road types.Only thing we've had to address in the 50K+ miles we've driven it was a new alternator. Was approx. $750 to replace, with parts& labor.

This thing is a beast when comes to snow. The miltary should pick this vehicle up. When it snows I feel like I can go any where. I wish it was a little bigger, of course i have the same complaint on most foreign automobiles. Third row seating is poor but it is a easy fix to take them out. i havent figured out this cassette thing is on the sound system.feel like I can go

I previously wrote of my frustrations with this SUV re: its quirks and lack of modern features. However, I live in the Midwest and we were hit with a torrential winter in 2010. I had no idea how awesomely this vehicle would perform in the snow and ice. It's unshakable. I felt very confident driving in ice and snow that left other trucks and SUVs in the snow bank. Unbelievably good traction.

Traded in an RX for an SUV with more room, comfort and performance.  So far, this truck has not disappointed. Great looking without being flashy, lots of room for large items, very comfortable on long trips and can get up and go if you hit the gas on the freeway.

Review_Title: If I knew then & Look Before You Leap
Review: Service, build quality, and drive could not be more impressive but this is the first car I have not connected with.  It just seems to have no soul if you know what I mean. It's personality is vanilla - unless u frequently drive off road. I loathe the navigation system. You can't do anything with it while u drive (including read song and artist names of music u are playing). No rear heat controls nor rear heated seats. 3rd row is a joke. My 5'1" wife cannot put the rear seats up or down... Terribly difficult. Not enough cabin storage for this size vehicle. Spend time with this car before you own it. This is a real SUV - Not a fun car to own just to carpool around town in.

This is a great SUV. It has great off road ability and as such some of the on road ride/performance is sacrificed but if you take it off road or drive in weather you will appreciate it. If your primary use is on road and in clear road conditions, you may want to go with another option. But if you drive off road, in snow, heavy rain etc. this is a great choice. I also am evidently one of the few that like the swing out door. It makes loading heavy objects (luggage, mulch etc,) simpler because you don't have to reach over a lowered tailgate. I have encountered more issues with ceiling height (garage) interfering with flip up gates than the swing out. 30,000 miles, not one problem.

Review_Title: Almost as Good as an AWD LS 460
Review: We purchased this car when my Sequoia died and I was left with an LS with RWD.  I compromised with the GX thinking to replace it when the LS came out with AWD.  Now, I'm not so sure.  The GX is almost as good.  I'm 6'2" and at 285 lbs, having done more than my share of weight lifting, I need comfort for my frame and plenty of space.  The GX does it.  It goes anywhere if you keep it shod with good tires, and never ever breaks down.  I travel a lot and need absolute reliability and this vehicle delivers.  It draws positive attention without being obnoxious.  Fuel economy, at an average of 18.9 is actually outstanding for a vehicle of this size.  Would I buy another--Yes.

Purchased my GX470 new in 2007. Very comfortable rise and fun to drive. Outstanding DVD and sound system. Multi-CD/DVD exchanger hard to reach. Arm rest on front seats are annoying as they keep locking in up positions. Poor gas MPG (18). Third row seating  cramped. Worst complaint is depreciation value. Pd. $58,000+ new, 1 1/2 yrs later, trade in value is $27K - $31K. (27K - 31K lost in 1 1/2 yrs.  Unbelievable!!)

Purchased it new in May 2007 with 4 miles on it (now has 4300+ miles). Traded in our Mercedes ML430 which was purchased new in June 1999. I drive my daughter everywhere in the Lexus & as a mom here are my 'annoyances': uncomfortable arm rest, not enough/poor center compartment design, unreachable CD-changer in glove compartment, shallow/poor location of front cup holder, inaccessible cup holders for rear seats when baby car seat is used in the center, rear seat A/C but not heat, swing open tailgate vs. lift-up, can only power on sound (not video) from front console for entertainment system  - must use remote control to power on. No issues with technical & mechanical aspects whatsoever!
Just bought my GX470. Its much roomier than my RX. Loving the car. The SUV hugs the road, drives great and Lexus's comfort is unmatchable to any other car.
I have always purchased BMWs, but decided to get a Lexus for a change.  I just traded it in and went back to BMWs.  The SUV is very well made, but is awful to drive.  We actually felt unsafe in ours.

After 4 RXs, I needed a change.  Voila the GX.  It is roomy, comfortable, sufficiently powerful, and beautifully finished.  Only cars with the 3rd row seat were available, but I would rather skip that expense and get a cargo cover instead.  The seats are stored, taking up room in my garage.  After owning 10 Lexuses, I am surprised at some of the features missing from this car, e.g. HID swiveling headlamps and in-dash CD player.  The RX is a much better equipped model for much less money.

This handles and drives so much nicer than my Toyota Sequoia.  The gas mileage averages about 18 combined city/hwy.  This is a great luxury SUV that drives very smoothly down the road.  It also performs very well in the snow and mud offroad.

Just drove my new GX 470 off the lot yesterday.  So far, I am loving it! It has plenty of room.  Very commanding on the road with the height of the vehicle.  Quality fittings.  Buy the ones with Nav.  Very high quality.  This is something I am going to keep for a while, a new one is worth the money.
This is my first Lexus and I love it, superb driving and luxurious.
Never liked SUV until I got into a GX 470. Doesn't feel like I'm in a SUV, more like a flagship Lexus sedan. Enough technology and features to stay updated for a long time.

This is my 5th Lexus, and I have previously owned the LX 470.  My GX has almost all the great amenities the LX did, but because it is a little smaller, much easier to manuever.  Not to sound sexist, but this vehicle fits a man.  My wife likes it, but prefers her RX 350 AWD.  And that is just fine with me!  I am averaging just over 18 MPG.  From my frame of reference, that's decent.  If I had wanted great mileage, I would have bought a Prius.  The ride is great, the stereo surround sound is great, and it is very quiet.  What else could one ask for?
Love It! Ride quality is a 10. Build quality is a 10. Silky smooth from start to finish.

I have bought new Cadillac Escalades, a new one every year starting in 02 . I live in the mountains of New Mexico and am not in good health so reliability and comfort are top of the list .  I had never even consided a Lexus . Drove the GX 470 and that was all it took, I traded my 06 Cad. I am very hard to please and I am truly happy with this car. You feel safe in snow, mud and on the highway. Value, check on the new price then look at a used one . Lexus holds its value. The heating and cooling are just right.  This is a 4x4 built for comfort and 20 mpg is great when you consider what American 4x4's get.

Review_Title: 9.5/10, just a few things to work on
Review: This vehicle is amazing. It has power and is full of torque. It has great pick up and the technology is fantastic. I'm very pleased with the comfort and the leg space, and the rear view camera is worth its weight in gold!

Absolutely L-O-V-E everything about my new Lexus.  GORGEOUS to look at and wonderful to drive.  I had a Toyota Sequoia before (which I also loved) but this is an SUV that drives like a car - so smooth!  Everyday I thank my husband for my new toy!

Just traded my 04 GX for an 07. Very reliable vehicle. Love the new generation NAV and Bluetooth. After shopping most of the lux brands, I still think the Lexus Nav is by far the best. I ski and the old GX was a great performer in the white powder of Tahoe. The drive is very comfortable and balanced no matter what the outside road conditions are.
This is an excellent vehicle!
This is my 2nd GX. This SUV gives the driver great command of the road, with all the bells and whistles. The GX drives very smooth, brakes are great as well as all the safety features.

This is the greatest vehicle I've ever purchased.  Fun to drive, and rides like a dream.  We test drove 14 other SUVs before our purchase of the Lexus. We are thinking about purchasing another GX 470 and replacing our 2004 Jaguar XJ8.

Review_Title: Now my old lady wants one too
Review: This is our 2nd Lexus but first Lexus SUV w/ a V8 eng.  This baby's ride is so smooth and quiet it's amazing that it have a V8 under the hood.  The acceleration is awesome especially when getting on freeway I have to learn not to step on the gas pedal too hard if there is car in front of me, otherwise I have to step on brake or I'm going to rear-end it.  We both love to drive so much that my wife want one too.
This is my first Lexus and I am very pleased with my purchase. The ride is smooth and the technology updates are great. I was over 1k miles in no time.
This is my 5th GX470 & my 15th New Lexus I just love them. They never break. Best vehicle on the road.
Just turn 200 miles. Excellent vehicle, love to drive, handles well and the Gen 5 Nav is outstanding. Great LUV.

This is my 4th Lexus SUV, and by far my favorite. It's unbelievably quiet, and tows a 6x10 covered trailer like nobody's businesss. LOVE the audio-in port, in which I can play my iPod or anything else. Brakes are steady and strong, not grabby. The new nav is mind- boggling and easy to use, and the bluetooth phone interface blows me away. There's lots of room for pax and cargo, and my dog loves the ease of access to the way back. Best vehicle I've ever owned.
Really nice suv but expensive.
Love it so much looks better the x5bmw or q5 audi and i came fron bmw fun club. Start to love lexus at the moment

This is my second Lexus SUV. Reliable. Purchased used with higher mileage. Have had no repair issues just basic maintenance like oil changes. My SUV is now 11 years old but looks new and rides like new. We get compliments frequently.Stylish and luxury at is best.Planning to buy my third Lexus SUV soon.

Got this GX-470 2003 back on 04/2003, fully loaded. Since then visited dealer once for turning signal light bulb (got replaced for free even after warranty expiration). Other than that - only scheduled maintenance. Never drove anything better than this (including x5/3.0-2007) before or after. Few days ago my daughter got hit by Civic into passenger side on a street (35 mph, at the time of impact even slower for both cars). My GX fell on driver's side, total loss. My girl landed on asphalt through drivers window under my GX, covered by broken glass, cut her left arm and elbow. Her passenger bumped her head. All bags in my GX are intact. WHAT IS SAFETY?

I've driven this SUV for over 6 years and its the best car I've owned. Service is excellent (especially the Naperville dealer) and the SUV has the best fit and finish of any car I've driven (including Mercedes and Porsche).  It continues to drive smoothly after 85K miles.  I hope to have it for 200K+.

Purchased my first Lexus from my BFF; GX is 5 years old with 35K miles; interior is in excellent shape, has held up well to 2 kids. Love the comfort selection option, comfort- sport. I have yet to find anything I don't love about this vehicle.  There is very little road noise; feature options are excellent; and the sunroof doesn't leak (like in other vehicles we've owned).  The rumble seats take getting used to - but easy to pop-up or put-down.

Very boring SUV. Its quiet and smooth and reliable but not for people who like to drive. And its good offroad! And without KDSS (additional option) the truck isn't very stable. And to top it off it loses a lot of market value.

I previously had a Navigator and a 2003 Range Rover. After major expensive problems with the RR, I wanted a SUV that was reliable and with the same luxury as the RR.  I decided on the GX470 because I am previously a Lexus owner. So I know the quality and the performance of the Lexus. It's not as big as the full size SUV but it is not as small either.  It was perfect for what I was looking for.

Traded a Honda Pilot for the GX.  Looks bigger than the Pilot, but its not on the inside, especially the 3rd row seat.  Build quality is great.  More like a truck than the Pilot, which I like-better 4 wheel drive system.  Overall, very nice vehicle and I will buy a Lexus again.

We have only owned it for a week, but we can't get enough of it! It is by far the most quality vehicle we ever owned, and blows away the 5 SUVs we've had in the past. It is such a smooth ride, the interior amenities are great. You truly feel "different" when you drive this car. Even though it is 3 years old, it looks and feels brand new. Sorry, I have to make this quick so I can go back and drive it somewhere... anywhere.

I just love this truck! It rides so smooth my husband calls it the airplane. No turbulence of course! The design is beautiful. It handles the road like a vehicle should. The V8 engine is great. The take off is fast and smooth.

My other vehicle is a Ford Explorer. There is absolutely no comparison at any level. This is the smoothest riding, most comfortable vehicle I've ever driven in and since it's a Toyota, reliability is key. I will never own any else.
I love my Lexus and cannot think of owning any other vehicle.  Toyota has a convert.
This is by far the best vehicle I have ever owned. I am now hooked on Lexus quality. Vehicle is luxurious and is a great ride for such a large vehicle.

Review_Title: Never thought I could *LOVE* an SUV!
Review: I'm a confirmed sedan gal, so imagine my surprise at how much I LOVE this SUV!It's quiet (more quiet than my previous E320 sedan),luxurious, and great looking.I don't have the ML stereo or navigation system and don't miss either.It's not without weak points: the way the 3rd row seats fold and stow looks amateurish compared to integrated ones in the Expedition,and the "gate" door has taken some getting used to (especially since it opens away from the curb).Yes, it's expensive, however; Lexus reliability is a given and the service is 2nd to NONE.You can't say that about many car makers.  You definitely get what you pay for with this vehicle.
THE ONLY IMPROVEMENT WOULD HAVE BEEN

column1: THE 3RD. ROW SEATS. SHOULD HAVE FOLDED
OUT OF THE WAY. I GET OVER 18MPG GOING
80MPH! NOT BAD FOR A BIG V-8 ALL WHEEL
DRIVE.......

Review: I moved from a Mercedes E class to an SUV.  Bought this after looking at other mid-size SUVs (wanted a 3rd row).  Came down to this and the Acura MDX.  No comparison in the comfort, despite Acura's very high reviews.  This drives more like a truck, but it is smooth as a Lincoln in there and VERY comfortable.  Nearly silent on the hwy.  Note: when the rear seats are folded up, there are definite blind spots, as they block the rear side windows, so be cautious.

Very Satisfied with this truck. Dealership service is better than anyone has the right to expect, although I've heard all Lexus dealerships not that great. Bought mine from McGrath Lexus- Westmont. Build quality top notch. I will always be a Lexus brand buyer from now on!
Great ride. I really like everything

column1: about it. Even if it is my wife's car.
Stereo (ML) really pumps (when my wife
is not in the car)

Review: I traded in my RX300, because I neededmore room, and a third row seat...Ireally liked my RX, and thought it drovevery well...I never expected to like theGX 470 as much as I do...it is head andshoulders better than the RX, I lovedriving it, and get lots of secondlooks, have caught more people than Ican count peering in, and commenting hownice it was.  Drives like adream...can't think of any other SUV onthe road that I would prefer...Love theLX, and this is just a smaller version.

I love this truck!!! When I 1st saw the GX  I was like I have to check this car out. I wasn't sold on the size at first because I wanted a large SUV, like an Escalade, Navigator or Yukon, but I couldn't resist the GX. It has the larger Suv's beat in Luxuary. IUt rides excellant, although it could have more horse power, come on Lexus designers, this SUV should not lag in that dept while beating the competition is other areas. Overall I love this truck, but my biggest complaint is that it can get pricy.

everything about the car is great.  except that the size of the gas tank is too small so  you often have to go to the gas station to fill up.  it only averages 300 miles on a full tank.  also, it lacks power.  car is very smooth and rides nice but it does not have enough acceleration for 4.7 liter 8 cyliner vehicle.  other than this, everything is great and i enjoy driving the car.
I LOVE IT! I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT AND IT SITS NICE AND HIGH, SO YOU CAN SEE ALL AROUND
We drove several luxury cars and SUV's

column1: before purchasing the Lexus GX470. When
it comes to true luxury you have to go
with Lexus. I have found nothing that I
didn't like about this SUV. The only
negative would be the price but it's
well worth it!!!

Review: So far so good. The GX470 has a great look, and even better performance. Smooth quiet ride and surprisingly easy to manuever thru city traffic. The only glitch I have found is the mirrors tend "forget" the drivers side memory when taking the car out of reverse.

I am quite pleased with GX 470 I purchased in late July.  My Blizzard Pearl GX has turned several heads.  I haven't seen this clor as of yet on the road or at any other local dealerships as of yet.  However, I plan to trade in my 2003 for a 2004 because I just can't live with the after market installed DVD system.  I will definately get the factory DVD this time. The current system doesn't take full advantage of the factory installed features like the Mark Levenson system or the factory installed system integration.  The backup camera in the 2004 will be a blessing.
So a wonderful vehicle to drive...no

column1: problems or issues.

Review: Fun and easy to drive.

Review_Title: Don't Believe The J.D. Power Report
Review: This is the best SUV I had drive, I've test drive the MDX, ML320, FX45, before buying the GX470. This SUV is very smooth, quiet, and powerful, and the quality is the best compare to other SUV's company.  Recently, I have checked the J.D. Power wed site about the GX470 rating, and I believe they have made a big mistake in rating this automobile or the people that do the evaulation did do it right!  So, don't believe every thing you read or see.

Review_Title: Get Rid of that Barn Door!!!
Review: My wife loves the barn door, its hercar, but come on Japan, you didn'tresearch the barn door enough.  It iscompletly unpractical forAmerica/Americans - you should onlyoffer it in other countries.  I can giveyou 20 plus examples why it is a poordesign.  The salesman said it was forsaftey, I just laughed and said it wasthe biggest line of BS a guy has eversaid to my face.  If you can get overthe BARNDOOR, this car offer sooo muchmore than all the competitors, the MBlooks like a minivan/mailvan, the BMWdoesn't even compare (it does in myopinion have the best rear door, Bringback the tailgate!!!!!!!) and the Volvois an underpowered joke.

Worried about vibration problem, but test drive before taking delivery eliminated as an issue.  First time Lexus buyer; currently own 2 BMWs. Almost bought X5, but quality issues steered me away. Glad I chose the GX470 - head and shoulders better than X5.
I love my GX. I reluctantly traded in

column1: my RX (which also was a great car)
because I wanted a little larger
vehicle. I am so glad I did. It drives
like a dream. I highly recomend this
vehicle.

Review: Bought the GX after looking at the Cayenne and the BMW. Better deal for the money; quality is better. Ride is stiff over heavy bumps in the rear, but the ride and cabin quiet is typical Lexus excellent quality. Engine is adequate for the vehicle; interior appointments are high quality. The rear door looks goofy and is impractical, particularly when towing our trailer. Stereo is excellent, and the nav system is very well-designed and easy to use. I like the size of the shifter, but there should be more of a gate between D and 4. Overall it's a great vehicle; great size, good power, great quality.
I had the RX300 before this, and to believe that the GX470 is twice the car is an understatement.  It is truely an amazing car.

Almost bought a ML500, glad we didn't! Dealership experience was good -- no high pressure, only professional salesmanship. Car is REALLY comfortable fun to drive! Killer navi system -- voice input and touch screen features are awesome compare to ML500's little joy stick thingy. Not too cracy about the swing-out back door at first, but actually like it now since we only use the 3rd roll seat for 1 person (my teenage kid) and he uses the back door for access so that he doesn't have to mess with the 2nd roll seat.
Got this Lexus loaded with every option

column1: except the Lexus Link - heard there
were problems with that!!!  We hope to
own this as long as we still own our LS
which is a 93. I know Lexus can make
cars that get good fuel economy - why
does this only get 15 city and 18
highway.

Review: Talk about a luxury vehicle!  This is

column1: the first Lexus I've owned and I'm
very impressed.  I like the fact that
there was only 3 main options to this
and everything else was standard.  It
made shopping for this so much
easier.

Review: We use our vehcle both for extensive highway as well as dirt road driving.  With the number of options avaiable for ride, vehicle height and severe driving condition contingencies, this SUV has it all.  Its ruggedness and durability, coupled with incredible interior accoutrements make for the perfect "country gentleperson's" all-purpose vehicle.

Beautiful car, easy and comfortable to drive.  Should have put in the back up camera and given additional color selections.  I am sold on Lexus and if I traded it in, it would only to get anything new they add to the newer models.  It is a beautiful vehicle.
This SUV is the best! The NAV system is

column1: awesome. Interior and exterior are
flawless. I am so happy with my
purchase!

Review_Title: lexus gx 470-  this female loves  it!
Review: The smooth comfort of the ride , especially for its size, is a huge reason I'm driving this SUV. It's comfortable, luxorious and versatile. It's everything we want in a family vehichle for the four of us, 3 of whom are big, tall guys who often are transporting sports gear.
Very smooth and quiet ride for an SUV.

column1: Perhaps the most sylish SUV on the road
to date.  Audio system is superb in
this vehicle.  Navigation system is
very helpful especially in unfamiliar
urban setteings.

Review: The GX 470 is fun and powerful driving

column1: machine. It is a good looker and not
something you see on the road every day.
The comfort and little creature
features of a Lexus are evidnet.
I upgraded from the RX 300 to the GX
470 without regrets

Review: No maintenance problems.  No noises.  (Should a "truck" be this quiet?). Refined yet functional. Superb all round performance. Very happy with it.

Of all the cars and SUV's I have ever had in the 32 years I have been driving, this car is the ultimate.  I have had no trouble whatsover with it.  It is fast off the line and rides wonderful!  I love the exterior design and the original rear end design, looks so sporty!  To think the BMW suv is 15,000.00 more that this!

Comparing the MDX, ML500, BMW, the GX470 is without a doubt the most luxurious of the SUVs.  An outstanding value considering what you get.  Lexus packages limited options because it already has most options you would expect.  Although the ML500 has better acceleration, the reliability is questionable.  The Lexus quality is what won me over.

Well, I wrote a review of my GX470 after only a couple of weeks and I was not very kind in my remarks. We have since driven the car on a couple of long trips as well as city stop and go traffic and I must admit, the car has proven me wrong! I love this vehicle and my wife does even more so. I took it in for routine maintenance and they gave me an RX300 as a loaner. I was so surprised at the difference. It made me even happier that we had chosen the GX470. It wasn't even a close contest. If you buy the GX, drive it a while before passing judgement. The pluses far outweigh the minuses! We're hooked!

Researched SUV's for months before deciding to purchase the GX 470.  This SUV fills a void in the market for larger SUVs priced below $60K.  Outstanding to drive with extremely comfortable ride. Overall, overly pleased with purchase, would highly recommend test driving.

Review_Title: GX 470: great unless you hold the wheel
Review: The GX 470 is easily the best driving, best handling SUV we have owned. However, there is a vibration in the steering wheel (even noted in the NY Times of 7/6/03. Also loud wind noise drowns out classical music at 60MPH. Interior is great, GPS finds places you could never drive to yourself.

Our first Lexus and I'll have to say, I've never been so dissappointed with an automobile. Transmission seems to slip on occassion and it takes bumps a lot harder than I assumed it would. When driving at low speeds up to about 50, it seems to be a little "jerky", for lack of a better term; almost as though it was shifting back and forth between gears. I would difinately test drive one and concentrate on the ride and not get so caught up in the luxurious interior and all of the whistles and bells. The automobile is beautiful inside and out. I just wish the performance matched the beauty. If I were to base Lexus on this GX470; I would never buy another one.

My new Lexus GX-470 is an amazing automobile to drive and own. It was purchased 1 month ago. I have driven a Lincoln Nav. for the past 4 years as well as a complete test, or comparison of the new Aviator. Although it is not fair to compare the GX-470 to a Nav., I found that in my complete comparison with the Aviator, among other SUV's, driving the Lexus, in all modes, was like riding on air, not to mention the silence inside while in operation.  It is extremely difficult to tell if the GX's motor is engaged, as there is no residual noise whatsoever.  Although it is an SUV, it rides more like a luxury car.  It is an amazing driving experience.
DID HAVE TO DRIVE THE CAR IN A HEAVY

column1: RAIN STORM
REABILITY SECOND TO NONE EXCELLENT ROAD
HANDLING

Review: Major problem for me with the GVWR recall which cost me big bucks.  I wouldnt put much stock in Lexus claims of customer satisfaction or service if the problem is substantial.  Even a small item took a trip to the dealership to resolve. Voice recognition is poor.  Basic air and sound controls is cumbersome.  Navigation system is easy to use, with very intuitive programming.  The premium sound system if excellent.  Limited storage for small items.  Dealer service failed to reset the service notice button.  During a trip an emergency notice come on saying we needed repair service, and should contact the dealer immediately.  That was a bit troubling, until

Review_Title: Stuck in Fresno with a GX
Review: Our fully loaded GX was delivered and

column1: we Loved it. However we learned of a
few flaws that were not traditionally
Lexus.( See Improvements) NOISE &
VIBRATION at 50+ mph and Fan Clutch
noise. I suspect the next year model to
address these issues. Problem is NOBODY
WILL WANT MY USED GX then. Quite
Unhappy

Review_Title: GX 470 in a class of its own
Review: The lexus GX 470 drives like a dream. It has all the features that you would want with an SUV at the same time feels like a car. Excellent Mark Levinson system. We love the SUV, it fits our family needs. It's a very fun vehicle and we enjoy it very much.

After shopping around for months for the ultimate Luxury Utility Vehicle, I came to the conclusion that the new Lexus GX 470 is it for me. I wanted to enjoy the well-known advantages of owning a Lexus including the award-winning customer satisfaction and high resale value but I didn't want just another one of the tens of thousands of RX 300's and the LX 470, while truly exceptional in just about every way, did not seem worth the extra $20,000. Driving down curvy mountain roads near Sedona in the GX 470 was as exciting and thrilling as downhill skiing!
This is our first Luxury Car.

column1: Previously we owned two Expeditions and
an Explorer. This time we wanted
somethng to take into retirement. I
couldnt be happier with the comfort and
grace this vehicle gives to us. Not a
squeak  or rattle (knock on wood) and
no recalls or problems with the dealer.

Review: My wife and I decided to trade in our suburban.  We looked at several SUV's, including a fully loaded Suburban, but as soon as we drove the GX we knew that it was just a matter of color.  This SUV provides as quite and smooth a ride as our Lexus GS sedan.  It was much better than the Suburban or Lincoln Navigator.  My family of 5 easily fits into the GX with room to spare. So, if you can give up the room of the Suburban, I highly recommend the GX.

You'd feel comfort, luxury and safety once you get on driver's seat. You sense you're surrounded by a solid, protective shield . . and that you are in for a smooth, powerful yet quiet ride. This was how I felt when I test drove the GX 47. (I rated it better compared to similar test drive with MB ML, 320 and 500). But back to my GX 470. The actual driving experience proved even more exhilirating. I have never felt so cool driving 400 miles each way ever. Why? Driving 70-75 mph was a breeze and accelerating to pass those semis was no sweat. The GX 490 is indeed my best driving experience ever.

I compared the GX with the Volvo XC90 but chose the Lexus due to immediate availability.  It drives nice, but I've had vibration issues at highway speeds that the dealer cannot replicate, the flip-up seats rattle, and the transmission slips and hesitates occasionaly.  Maybe I should have bought the Volvo...
great car, reliable, quiet, great handling, but it could use more horsepower for a v-8.

What a great car.  Already own an LS and thought the GX would be a great addition.  As usual, the car is a great Lexus product, but they should have continued the thought process on the last 6 feet of this vehicle.  The rear door is terrible.  The way that you have to manually lift up the third row seats is something you would find in a $10,000.00 SUV.  The head rests are so big, you can't recline them and move the seats behind.  Using a strap to hold the third row seats up is also a bit cheap, inconvenient and un-imaginative.  Come on Lexus, you have an absolute 10 if you would fix these problems.  Everything else, perfect!!

Problems: 1) Lexus dealerships stuff all options on vehicle and make it difficult to order without certain options(like third row seats, Lexus Link)2) there is an unacceptable vibration which occurs at approx 1700 rpm and is accentuated at approx 60 mph...as noted in another review there is no fix yet. I am UNHAPPY.
When you unlock the car the lighting

column1: seems to softly glow to on. It is very
welcoming.
The seats are very comfortable and it
was easy to get them into the right
setting quickly.
The Nav must be the best on the
market.Loaded with features and all of
them are easy to operate.
The Mark Levinson system sounds
amazing. Controlling it from the
steering wheel makes it very easy to
use. Cruising at 70-75 the engine is
very quite with an MPG of around 19.

Review: Many SUV/LUVs to choose from, but this one is the most practical car for my family. Already spoiled by the lexus luxury ride and comfort of my 98'ES, we could not settle on X5 or MDX. I found X5 to be a stylish fun car to drive but way behind the GX's silky ride comfort and space. MDX being a good value SUV but lacks the luxury that Lexus provides.GX is a magnificient blend of luxury and utility accompanied by unsurpassed Lexus customer service, and proven reliability, engineering and technology. It simply works great for my daily use as well as family vacation trips.

Drove the Discovery, RX330, X5, QX4, MDX. none had the comfort and styling as the GX. So smooth. Nav system is intuitive.Xenon lights not available because car height would cause blindness to oncoming cars

i sold a LS430 LOADED, AND PURCHASED THE GX470, I MISS SOME OF THE OPTIONS  BUT I AM VERY PLEASED WITH LEXUS, PURSUIT TO PERFECTION, AND I BELIEVE THEY ARE THE CLOSEST. I HAVE OWNED THEM ALL BMW 740 IL, MERCEDES S BODY, FOR PURE QUALITY LEXUS IS #1.

I have been driving an ML 320 for the past 3 years, finally I got rid that nightmare tri star. The GX 470 is a completely better SUV all around compare to the ML 320, it behave very well for such a large vehicle. Smooth engine, quite interior and very well built vehicle, if you are in the market for a luxury SUV, give the GX 470 a try. You will like it. Dealers begin to discount now, so shop around and enjoy your new toy. I got a great deal from Lexus of Thousand Oaks ( I got a fully loaded one for way below the MSRP )

Recently replaced 2000 Mercedes ML 320 with GX 470.  Mercedes had dozens of reliability problems. GX is much quieter, smoother and more versatile in terms of interior layout. Third row seats are easy for one person to remove.  Fuel mileage is better than expected at over 17 mpg in mixed driving.

Review_Title: Very nice, but needs some tweaks
Review: Driving this car is like piloting a cloud.  Incredible ride - very quiet and very smooth!  The 3rd row seating is a bit of a joke though.  I'm only 5'7" and I couldn't bare to sit back there for more than 10 minutes.  There's no way you could get 3 adults back there comfortably.  Plenty of room on the 2nd row of seats, so much so that they should have moved those forward 3 inches to give the 3rd row more room.  The Radio controls kinda suck since they put many of them on the video display screen which takes a long time to navigate, and a lot of attention which would be better spent driving.
Great car loved it alot

I have never owned this smooth vehicle in my life. Usually trucks which have superb offload capabilities don't have such luxurious ride on paved roads. This is the quietest  vehicle I have ever owned both on gravel and on paved roads. The Only draw back is the MPG.  If gas consumption is not a problem, it is the best SUV to own with no unexpected maintenance.

Review_Title: Used GX after 11 years of travels
Review: Have owned over 50 cars in my 22 years of driving :) picked up car with 145k miles for $12k with luxury packg , great value for the money . Drove Porsche suv and Mercedes suv in same price range they will fall apart with that mileage asap . On high mileage cars expect $2000 a year in maintenance. Car is extremely comfortable has the best sound system in class for the money , not a single rattle in the cabin after 11 years . Will burn 13mpg in town and 17-19mpg hwy. Will cross any ice snow mud river and hill you can throw on it . Does 8.8s to 60mph . People have them with 300k miles on first transmissions :) it's land cruiser prado - in Asia and Australia used also by fire/medical departments .dont be afraid of high mileage just check carfax service history , the looks will grow on you . Recommended for adventures and families, it goes anywhere beside heavy rock crawling trails. Feels like a tank drives like a sedan and parks very easy . Get only the ones fully loaded .Dont buy without mark levinsons audio or backup camera .it axes me that people still give it compliments and think it's triple the money paid :)

It's now 11 (12) years and we're just now thinking of getting another car.  We took out the third row seats, and removed the 1/3 section of the second row.  This is perfect for getting the dog in and out, and when traveling long distances, one person can completely lay out from back door to back of the front seat (though it may not be the safest thing to suggest).  We have never regretted taking out those seats, as it about doubles the space in the back.  We removed the third row from my LX too, though kept my second row intact.  The GX has just come through it's second sunroof leak, only this one is really bad, because it sat for weeks before we were around to notice.  Don't know if it's related or not, but the shocks spent so much power trying to equalize, due to a malfunction, that they drained the battery.  Now that the car is dried out, we see it's still broken,  a $4,000 fix, and the whole interior mildewed from the leak.  The roof problem wasn't fun the first time, when the water filled the glovebox, but when it's the whole car, it's debatable if we keep or move on.  Apart from these problems, I would have nothing negative to say, and are so pleased to have towed so many trailers, hauled heavy stuff, dog and people year after safe year.(UPDATE)  After it was 'fixed' from second major sunroof leak, drove the car from one house to the other, did fine for the 700 mile drive, just like usual.  After it sat in garage a week, took it out to go somewhere.  The mildew was coming back and I couldn't stop coughing.  We put the car back in garage, and then gave it to a non-profit trail conservation group, whose pickup truck had just died.  We feel it should do well for them for many years, maybe another decade, as a substitute for the purpose they need, despite the mildew.  My husband decided to get the 2017 Honda Ridgeline and see if that can be a good substitute.  When it comes my time to get a new car, though I'm not sure when, as my 2005 LX 470 is a workhorse on its own and doing well, too, I'll probably stick with the Lexus, maybe the LX570.

I special ordered the 2005 GX470 Sport over 10 years ago.  I love this car!  I now have 150,000 miles on it and have never had a single problem.  I am very hesitant to trade her in but when I do I will buy the same newer version.  Great job LEXUS.

Having owned Lexus before I knew this would be a very reliable car.Gas & go.Maintain per mfg recommendations and it will last forever.What it is for: In town errands; carrying clean cargo like groceries and such; long road trips; ski trips; car pools.What it's not for: Work truck; off roading; hauling heavy trailers; hauling construction supplies or plant material.It's a soccer mom car.Reliable, elegant, comfy.Zero excitement but what SUV is?

My dad and my mom bought this car after my mom had been looking for MONTHS! When i first saw he car i thought it looked decent. We happened to be at an away game for my school, and I could not wait to get to ride home in the car, But then the second i got in the car I was SO disappointed! I could hardly fit in the back seat! There is absolutely no room! also, another problem that we had was the navigation screen. I mean my family was so confused cause, you run the climate from that screen, the radio, the DVD player, and everything else that would have been a lot easier just to make buttons for. My family has not liked this car at all! I mean 16 mpg highway, I mean come on. Just don't get this car!

I love my new (to me!) Lexus.  We traded in a 08 Town & country for a 05 LX470 with twice the miles and were happy about it! This car is wonderful.  It is spacious and fun to drive.  My only complaint is that the trunk area is small with the third row seat down, I can't even get my stroller in.  But, we will make do. It is the best car I have ever had, even better than my husband's 08 BMW!

Bought car brand new. Squeaky brakes when car had 20,000 mi. Initially intermittent, then became consistent. Multiple dealer services not solved. Was told by Service Adivor & Manager common for these cars, in fact was told many new Lexus vehicles squeak and nothing can be done. What a disappointment. We're not talking about Pintos here. No vote of confidence from Lexus trained personnel. Would not recommend Lexus base on above comments from a service manager and adviser. Buyers beware. Can you imagine spending premium dollars and was told they naturally squeak? Car is still new!

This is my 3rd Lex still own the the 2nd one which is a 2000 RX300, this is one big bad ride the v8 is nice and smooth and has a great growl, the Mark Levinson sound system (14 speakers) is outstanding, great suv overall.

My GX 470 has had and continues to have problems with the navigation, radio, rear camera, console. It is currently at the dealer's for the third time - 11 days so far - still they are not able to diagnose and or fix the problem(s).They have replaced the radio head twice without fixing the problem. It is probably time to ask for a new one or have them refund my money.

Review_Title: Great Value for a Luxury SUV
Review: I live in the mountains and work in real estate. My driving habits are much more demanding than the typical buyer. I use the vehicle regularly in wintry conditions and also off road. In both capacities, the vehicle is extremely capable and gives the driver lots of confidence.  The SUV is very luxurious and has much better build quality than its American competitors. Nav, Bluetooth, rear-view camera, and DVD all work well.  I get around 16 MPG, but that is better than other heavy SUVs  that get around 12-13 MPG in this area.

This is our 3rd Lexus trading up from the RX model. The main reason we bought the GX is its size while driving around Florida. We are totally thrilled with the performance of this vehicle. The interior is well appointed and is the best ride we have had in years owning a vehicle. Driving is a joy on a calm day. If it is windy you are going to struggle with the wheel when sudden gust prevail. Passenger seating is very good in the back except for the cargo area fold down seating. Just try to get back there. Leg room zero and tolerable for young kids. Cargo area and rear door needs work. With cargo seats stored you are limited with space for any large items unless you remove the seats.

Lexus build quailty and service is there but not much else. Really stiff ride and "bucks" over the slightest bump, so much so I took it in to be checked and they said it's normal? Nav voice command is a joke. Audio, climate, etc. controls through the nav screen are a huge inconvenience. Third row seats are good for say what, ages 5 and under? Just really unhappy with this truck as a whole. We are trading in the GX tomorrow. I will be happy to see it go.

An older design that has held up very well. Light on certain features vs newer competition but so well executed it doesn't matter. I've owned too many SUVs and was let down by their quality and resale value. Finally, I looked for the best 50K-60K SUV out there and worked backwards from the resale figures. What I found was a capable and incredibly reliable SUV. Stout mechanicals covered with Lexus jewelry. I have no complaints and my wish list isn't really valid... what I wish for generally wasn't allowed for in the design years ago. One thing amazes me though, the HP & torque figures are pretty lame considering the weight (235/320 & 4900+), Toyota somehow makes it feel much stronger.

Lexus just has a feel and style that can't be beat.  The GX470 is a great overall vehicle but has terrible fuel mileage.  I average around 13 MPG.  The ride is exceptional on highways but a little top heavy around town and on curvy country roads.  It is as quiet as you would expect a Lexus to be.  Towing is amazing with the Class V hitch.  The Mark Levinson sound system is absolutely incredible.
This is the best SUV I have ever driven. Rides smooth, handles great. I would buy another one.

It is a wonderful vehicle to own. The only negative comment that I have is that it is not very roomy in the back seat. We have three children and two of them are in carseats. They do not have any extra room. The third back seat does not have any leg room at all.

This is a great truck.  Love the ride, handling, comfort and looks.  I'm 6'2", so I had no problems to fit inside, unlike 4runner or VW Touareg.  Highly recommend this vehicle. Much better than Mercedes and BMW.  NAV system in not as good as other competitors and voice activated commands doesn't work as it suppose to. Because of the cabin noise from AC or heater it doesn't recognize commands.  Overall I'm happy with the purchase. There are, of course, a lot of things for improvement, majority of which I listed in the Improvements section. I also would like to see front connectors on the radio to be able to hook up the iPOD/MP3 player.

Review_Title: I wish I had one of these years ago !!!
Review: Great--just great. Like me, I think its perfect and like me there is room for improvement. Third seat should fold into floor to allow better rear vision and add more storage room. While it's built on a truck frame, it rides ever so smoothly. Passenger side seat should have 6-way power and larger sun visor. Interior is luxurious--navigation system is great help (once you learn how to use it). Optional sound system is Carnegie Hall quality.

What's not to love about this suv!? It is super comfortable and drives so smooth.  The extras like the navigation and DVD system are great and very user friendly.  The sound system is top of the line. On top of all that it looks great.  I also like that I only have to get the oil changed every 5K miles. I have taken it on several road trips always feel safe and comfortable on the interstate. Keeping this car for the four years that I promised my husband will not be hardship at all!!
Fun to drive. Very  stylish. Best Nav system out there. Much better then my Mercedes CL 500! Decent pick up for a heavy SUV. Pretty enough to be a car for Sat night out! Love it.

I love Lexus! This LUV has a great third row seat that helps hold a total of 7 cheerleaders and one mom! It has all of the luxeries you could want and more! I have the pearl white and the paint is just awesome! I really enjoy this vehicle and I do drive it alot. It was the only midsize LUV with the extra seating room. It is stylish and practical all at the same time!

Have been most impressed by the GX470.  Very solid feel, excellent performance and good safety features.  Just the right size for me, kids grown with only grandkids to haul now.  Would recommend this vehicle to anyone, usual Lexus quality, no problems after 9,000 miles.

I love it.  I'm up high.  It is reliable and I feel safe.  It is a heavy car without being too big.  I wish there were turn signal arrows on my side mirrors like I've seen on other cars, so I never leave the damned turn signal on, confusing other drivers.  I also wish the navigational system were easier to operate. I'd like a camera in the front too.  But the only really big safety change I would want is for far better "blind spot" vision.  Changing lanes is still not safe enough and the Lexus doesn't make it easier. Overall, it is a much more comfortable car than the two Mercedes I had before it, including a large Mercedes SUV.  It is a softer ride.
overall it is a good car and fun to drive with ample power with good finish quality.
Excellent car and great service as usual from Lexus.  Rear transaxle gets loose and needs to be tightened every 10,000 miles.  Lexus stands behind every detail.

Looked at many other suv's, but loved this one! I have had it for almost a year and an very happy with it. I have just reached 12,000+ miles and the car still looks brand new! It drives very comfortably and is spacious! The trunk is a bit small when the third row is down, but i love the third row option. People tend to complain about the trunk door, but it has not bothered me once! Its a great car and should last a good long time, both the interior and engine! :)

MY "LUV" rides like a plane. On a recent trip the ride was so smooth (we have the worst roads in LA) I had to remember it was a freeway and not the airway. Love the looks I get at stop signs, red lights, etc. Started to purchase a Tahoe. Started reading the reviews on the GX470 on this site  and had to test drive.  Our city does not have a Lexus dearship, had to travel 125 miles to test drive.  It was well worth the trip. The test drive had me sold, didnot want to leave the GX, but had not come prepared to buy.  Within the week, we went back and drove our GX home. Once you drive or ride--you're hooked. So glad I made the purchase-- always looking for somewhere to go so I can drive it.

We purchased the car after downsizing from a Toyota Seqouia (which is another great vehicle). Both my children have gotten their licenses and being an active family from skiing to the beach house, this suv gives you the room, comfort and reliability woth no worries

Review_Title: I had to write about it!
Review: I normally would not take the time to write a car review, but this SUV really deserves it. It's actually my wife's car but I find myself making up goofy excuses to drive it because it is so nice. The Lexus quality is #1 as is their customer service. I bought chrome factory wheels from an Amarket wheel shop and in the swapping out process they broke a wheel stud off. I took the truck back to the dealer for the fix expecting a line about how I would be responsible for the cost since I did not have them do the install. Not even a funny look from the service advisor, on the contrary; a danish, cup of coffee and an apology for the inconvienence. Do yourself a favor and test drive this truck!!!!!

I love my Lexus, I had a Jeep before the Lexus RX 470. The Lexus is an 8 cylinder and the Jeep was a 6 cylinder and we are getting 18.7 miles to the gallon on our Lexus. The same as the 6 cylinder Jeep. I drive about 160 miles a day back and forth to work and home. Gas mileage and comfort is important to me and this SUV delivers everything i could possibly want and more. This March after a snow storm I came upon a patch of road near the river that had frozen and two cars had landed in a ditch the Lexus drove right over the patch of ice and did not slide at all, I did not have the SUV in 4 wheel drive. I feel so safe in this SUV. I love the RX470 and it is well worth the price. I use the GPS all the time.

Therere high frequency squeaks (buzz) fr under the dash every 2-3 brake pedal application in my new GX470. It makes me feel uncomfortable & distractive when I'm driving. However, Lexus said it is caused by ABS braking system and it is a normal characteristic from ABS actuator and no repairs are necessary. It could be a normal characteristic if actuator buzz from OUTSIDE car and do not bothering people in the car. However, it is problem if a noise is annoying people INSIDE the car. This is definitely an unsafe driving condition to any driver. I purchased Lexus w/the high expectation of it's quality&services.  But I experience the absolutely worst I have ever had. I need HELP & good advise.
Exceptional vehicle!  Extremely comfortable, quiet and fun to drive.  Handles and responds very well.  Has a lot of the functionality of a truck, but drives like a car!!  I love it!

Have a 05 4 Runner Ltd.   The GX takes that platform and tops it off.  They may have the same meat but you can certainly tell the difference and to me worth the price.  If a Bells and whistle person you got to give the vehicle a look.  soft leather, power steering wheel, 14 speaker Audio, better overall interior.  Nav system thought it was high well once have one they are neat. Nice wood accents.
This car is by far the best I've owned. It rides smoothly, making it a pleasure to ride. While the gas mileage is not great, it's good for an SUV.

The GX 470 is a great balance of luxury and performance. I feel like I am still in a truck capable of going off-roading in difficult conditions yet still feel like I am in a smooth riding high end sedan.  Great vehicle overall!

This  vehicle is great.  The handling, power and comfort are amazing.  The engineers did their homework and anticpated needs I was unaware I had. I strongly recommend the Navagational/DVD options. My model has the Dynamic Kinetic System and drives backroads like it is on rails.
This is my fourth Lexus and my third SUV.  Had the the large SUV, in fact two of them and both are great
Excellent vehicle. Performance is great. Fuel economy is a factor, but it's V8 4,7 so it's not that bad. Interior is luxurious, ride is fun.

I was not a lover of cars. I usually consider myself a bus driver because I am usually driving a carload of children to where they need to be. I like to drive to get where I am going and that is it. I have also driven all types and makes of cars. (My first car was an escort.) I never thought I would ever be committed to one kind of car or maker. I love the Lexus GX 470! This SUV is a great car with the most comfortable ride you will ever experience. I have never had any maintenance issues. In fact, the dealership has gone the extra mile for me and my famlies safety. I would recommend this car to anyone looking for an SUV.  You will be hooked like me!

The Lexus GX 470 is probably the most reliable, comfortable, and well designed SUV that I have ever owned. My previous cars were GMC Jimmy, Land Rover, Range Rover, and now GX 470!  It is much better than the Range Rover in every way and I can lease 2 GX's for the cost of 1 Range Rover.
Quiet, smooth handling, comfortable, feel safe, thoughtful interior design, advance technology (blue tooth, navigator system), user friendly.
Very comfortable and luxurious. Gas mileage is good. Engine has great pickup. 4WD handles well.

I've had the Suv for a month and a half, and everything is great.  Not even one thing to bring back in for, not even one problem.  Gas Mileage is no good, but knew that when I purchased it, so not an issue.  VERY comfortable vehicle, rides and handles extremely well.  Really enjoying owning this.  Jay
This vehicle is the best car I have ever owned.  Its fun to drive, has a lot of passenger room and storage.  The gas mileage is much better then most SUVs.  It's sporty looking and very versatile.

I have only had this vehicle for a short time however it is typical Lexus quality-build. Gas mileage is not the best but better for an engine of this size and class of SUV, something I realized when buying. The sound system is excellent and optional sport edition adds an extra flare each time I get inside. Lexus dependability/safety/durability/peace of mind is something that comes standard with the MSRP...

We love this vehicle! I traded in a BMW 525i and a Jeep Liberty both with low miles. We can honestly say this is the best driving experience we have ever had. I can assure you that we have had some wonderful automobiles but, nothing beats our 2004 Lexus GX 470. We have style, grace and superior handling all rolled into one vehicle. Long trips are a breeze compared to any other vehicle and I really loved my BMW 525i until I gave it up for a Lexus GX 470. It's a Superb blend of quality and handling. We love it!
This car is amazing. It has every feature you could dream of!! The smoothness of the ride makes make it feel more like a plane gliding along the road.

Everything about this vehicle makes it a dream to drive.  It is a luxurious SUV with thoughtful additions that make driving a pleasure.  I like the features for the radio on the steering wheel and all the cup holders are well placed. Everything is automatic from the wipers to the steering wheel movement. It is an extremely comfortable ride too!

Over all this has been a good vehicle to date.  There have been a few problems with the drive shaft slip-yoke.  There is also a persistant coolant smell which Lexus claims is normal.  Next year I may trade the GX for an '07 Escallade.
Great car, however hunts for gears while crusing at 80mph plus up and down hilly terrain.  Nothing a supercharger wouldn't fix!  I hope TRD is reading this.

My Lexus GX470 is by far my favorite vehicle. I've had other luxury vehicles in the past but hands down the GX470 outperforms all of them. It's an SUV that can take on the rugged terrain, yet drives like a luxury sedan. The interior is quiet and comfortable. If you have children there is plenty of leg room not to mention 3rd row seating.  It's extremely easy to get my infant in and out of the vehicle. No more back problems!  More than enough room to throw all of your luggage or shopping bags!  I love it!!!  Angie from AZ

Review_Title: All in all a good package
Review: Excellent visibilty and instrumentation is easy to see and adjust.  Fuel economy on the low side and fuel tank is grossly undersized.
I love this car! I just got it and it's wonderful to drive. My kids love it too.They love the DVD player. I really love the navigation system.

Traded in 2003 Range Rover due to really lousy mileage and high test gas requirement; the GX 470 rides like a baby carriage, takes regular gas and is excellent on milage.  It is comfortable, easy to drive and very user friendly. Additionally, its spacious cabin and top notch appointments make long hauls a delight.  Its ability to "kneel" for exiting of back seat passsengers is a real plus for kids and oldsters, alike.  The NAV system and the Blue Tooth capability and voice command ability really puts it ahead of any other SUV I test drove, and the reverse camera is something every car should have!  The "dipping" sideview mirrors in Reverse are also very useful.

After surviving a near-fatal 50-mph rearend accident as the driver in a sports car, I wanted something more substantial behind my body.  The GX- 470 gives me all the security I need and more.  I cannot imagine feeling safer in a vehicle yet the ride and comfort baby my damaged back and neck.  The short list is what to change--more cup holders, uhh, dash input for digital player,  maybe 4 inches longer for more room for cargo?   It's damn near perfect!

Review_Title: My 7month old Son Loves His New Car
Review: I love this car. Like they say once you go Lexus you never go back.  The reliability, comfort, and customer service can't be beat.  Like I said my seven month old son loves his new car.

Purchased 2005 GX470 after test driving MDX, Navigator, Aviator, Denali, BMW SUV. GX does have an excellent ride  BUT Lexus needs to pay more attention to option detail. Lexus NAV system ranks far behind Acura and Mercedes (I own both). Mark Levinson sound system is average, at best. Also ranks behind Acura and Mercedes. Bluetooth phone capability is a joke. Just found out that you can't get a Verizon phone to work with the system. Voice activated NAV and audio is useless. This is a $50,000+ luxury vehicle that should NOT have these issues. Lexus needs to take a look at what Acura (my daughter's TSX) and Mercedes (my wife's E320) have accomplished and learn from them. Thinking of trading in.
Very Good on perfomance, comfort,Fuel Economy, Interior Design, Exterior Design, Build Quality, and Reliability

This vehicle is one of the best vehicles we have ever owned...maybe the best, but we have only owned it for 1 month, so we will need more time to evaluate it.  The only better SUV will be the hybrid GX470H(?) to help fuel economy.  The GX has every option we were looking for and more.  The navigation is tremendous!  It does everything for you.  I am a car buff and do not really care for Japanese imports, but the GX470 is the benchmark in all catagories for the USA to strive for. Buy it...you'll like it!
I just traded a 2002 Toyota Sequoia and I really didn't know the meaning of a luxury driving feeling before I got into the GX 470. I love it!

This is a beautiful SUV, well designed for passenger comfort and with all the elegance and refinement one should expect from a vehicle in this price range.  It has but one flaw --- it is NOT rock-steady at highway speeds in the wind and has more "slip stream" wobble when it encounters 18-wheelers than our Grand Cherokee!  This is obviously due to its height/tread width ratio and would approach "perfect" if shaved down a couple of inches or (better yet) based on a wider platform.  Overall a wonderful vehicle but I would NOT have purchased it had I tested its highway performce in advance.

Over the last 8 years I have owned the following SUVs ... Mitsubishi Montero, Mercedes ML 430, BMW X-5 4.4i, Infiniti FX. All of these have been top of the line and fully loaded with every option in the book. This time, I shortlisted and test drove the Range Rover, The LX470, the Cayenne, the Touareg  the MDX, and finally the GX 470. Other then the 3rd seat (which despite the bulk, is still very convenient for my 6 and 10 yr old), there is simply no down side to this SUV. Even the gas mileage is good (18 mpg) considering it weighs in at 6800 pounds. It beats its own older brother (the LX 470) at its game for $15000 less. If you need a large SUV with superb comfort, you need not look any further.

Review_Title: Love It!  Love It! Love It!
Review: I love my new truck!  It is the perfect size - not too big, not too small.  My only complaint is that there are not enough compartments for storage.  But, I do realize I had to give up something to get the smaller vehicle that I wanted.  The ride is great.  My 10 year has plenty of room in the middle.  I have not yet used the 3rd row, so I have no comments about that.  I do know I will stay in this vehicle for a long time.  I was ready to get rid of my last SUV 4 months after I purchased it because it was just too large for me to handle.  This is worth every penny spent!

I test drove almost every suv out there.  From the moment I drove the GX, I loved it.  I now own it for six months. It is wonderful.  I recently hit a deer.  The car did not skid. It was solid and kept us safe.  I love driving it.  It feels dreamy to drive.  Love the seats, interior, radio etc.  This is my first Lexus.  I also own a Mercedes C320.... would consider trading it in for a Lexus in the future.  The Lexus people have great service.

Very dependable. It rides so smooth you'll think youre in a limousine.  There's so little outside noise you can forget you are in a car.  Handles impeccably for a 4-wheel drive.  The fuel consumption isn't great but it's tolerable. The instrument panel is easily understood but the navigation system and voice control system is unfortunately confusing. The car is very comfortable and the climate control system is very good.  The DVD is easy to use and components can be added easily.  There is an AC outlet included in this SUV which allows you to plug in accessories or a playstation for your child. This SUV rides great and is an overall great value.
The vehicle is the best! I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a comfortable ride in a SUV. THe interior and exterior are very nice!

Only had the suv for 8 days and love the luxury and the handling.  It is a really beautiful vehicle.  I was driving an 8 year old Toyota 4-Runner with 142,000 miles. Quite a change from the Toyota.  Gas mileage is not too good, but I knew that before I bought the vehicle.  I was looking at the MDX but it was not a luxurious as the Lexus

The reviews are right.  You won't miss the LX 470.  The GX 470 is Toyota's best SUV in my mind.  All the features and options I wanted at a reasonable price. I even found it fun and easy to install the rear spoiler myself. I would definitely buy one again.

Review_Title: This is one of the BEST go anywhere SUV in the mar
Review: It's my 1st SUV and I would like a 4x4 SUV that I can minor off-road and go to snow without a problem and this car never let me down..already 120,255 miles and no problem at all.Reliable,Durable,comfortable and very high resale value..it's a Lexus and version of Toyota Land Cruiser prado in other country..and last year  i got a new Landcruiser200...

Review_Title: Does not fit 2 Car Seats in 2nd Row
Review: I saw a posting that it fits multiple car seats in the 2nd row.  This is not a correct statement.  One Car seat will fit fine, but due to the position of the 2nd latch behind the drive it will not probably hold the car seat still.  It is not positioned on par with Federal Guidelines.   NHTSA certified fireman said he could not properly install the seat due to the positioning as it of center.  So don't buy if you need multiple car-seats in the 2nd row.

Review_Title: Lots of pluses, lots of minuses
Review: Our old car was a Ford expedition (Eddie bauer 2003) and I wanted to downsize. We shopped through lots of suvs and finally settled on the gx470.  There were a couple of requirements: smaller size and tough four wheel drive vehicle, along with great reliability.  The gx met these requirements.  But, the interior left so much lacking.  I wanted the quality of a Japanese built car and this is built in Japan, but this suv was designed for the Japanese.  The seats are way too small (no one should buy this vehicle that is anywhere near 6 feet tall) and the drivers compartment is crampedbase of seat is inches shorter than the expedition, ashtrays everywhere but no personal storage.

Review_Title: Tough choice but happy with the GX
Review: We had a tough time deciding between this and the ML.  In the end, Lexus reliability and interior finish were what sold us.  For the money the interior of the Lexus felt more polished (totally a personal choice here) than the M.  Although the GX does have a tape deck, which definitely is dated!  Seats are comfortable and layout of dash made sense.  Also, the crossover drive feel of the ML, RX and MDX was unappealing to us.  The GX works well for male & female but the Xovers felt very girly.  After 2 months of use we really are pleased with it.  Ride is comfortable around town as well as freeway, fuel economy as with others in this class is OK.  Fits 2 car seats easily.

This Lexus GX has been a headache since the day it was purchased since new. The interior materials are cheap, rivaling fisher price products, the seats are hard and unsupportive, the suspension sqeaks and the dealer can’t fix it, etc. The car also suffers from technology that is slow, frustrating to use, and severely outdated. For a 4.6 Liter V8, power is minimum with poor braking to assist it. The steering is very vague.  The car has had 4-5 unexpected visits to the dealer, fortunately covered from warranty. Did I mention rust? This car is already rusting, with it only covering 70,000 miles. The good points of this car include the dealer being easy to work with, and lots of room with the seats folded. For a 65,000 car, this car is in no way worth it.

Review_Title: Don’t listen to the cross-over crowd
Review: I owned a Toyota 4-Runner for 3 full years. It was a wonderful vehicle but I really wanted something more refined. The GX 460 fits the bill perfectly. I am not a fan of the over rounded rear vehicle cross-over SUV’s. They all look the same, the shape of the cargo hold isn’t practical and they rarely even handle a few inches of snow well due to run-flats and low profile tires. I applaud Lexus/Toyota for refusing to go along with the cross-over crowd on the GX and 4-Runner models.   When I compare the GX to the 4-Runner, I would say it’s much more refined on all fronts. The V8 engine is smooth and quiet, the acceleration is very solid - not a turbo, but more than sufficient, the seats are extremely supportive and comfortable, the Mark Levinson sound system is fantastic, the build quality and reliability are exceptional. Purchase this SUV with confidence. I’ve owned almost every make and model of SUV on the market and the GX is hands down my favorite.
Some very nice luxury features. Driver seat material is separating below the seat and not easily fixed
The size
I Bought a New Lexus after owning a Black 2012 Gx460 . I loved my 2012 so I just bought the same Veh. in White. Couldn't be happier with it.
It’s a Lexus, you really can’t go wrong. Customer Service is always A1. This is our third!
Was looking for a truck platform that rides smooth. This 460 is that. I had a 2016 MDX and hated it.

I have this car for the past 4 months and I love it every time I step in. Now, this car is old school and  it lacks some of the latest gadgetry but other than that this car is best the SUV ever.
